channel.title: The Old Hacker's Blog
channel.description: Musings and ravings from the heart of Olde England

item.title: PC Grates
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Much of the time, my computer is an annoyance. I sit down at my computer and I meet junk mail in my inbox, invitations to purchase this or that and the endless invitations to fill out a survey.
In my browser, prompts to update my phone number so that I can be cold-called, then emails to tell me that I've updated my phone number. Overlays on so many websites, and so much scripted junk and adverts that Reader View becomes a necessity. Have a chat! Tell us why you visited this site!

item.title: PC Greats
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Media!
This blog, music, getting in touch with people I like.

item.title: Marketing jargon
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Marketing jargon is used to make ordinary tasks sound exciting.
"grow your WordPress site" *improve
"Proudly powered by WordPress" *created using uses virtue signalling and action terms

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Cleaning, picking up apples, washing clothes, and shredding paper. Knackered now :-)

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: 12-odd hours sleep last night and 1.5 hours sitting meditation yesterday

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Felt really rubbish yesterday evening, lots of stomach pain, and took four Nurofen Plus in the end. Thinking that I might have to miss my pension appointment, but realised that it could be sorted with a few phone calls. Slept fine, but kept waking up and going back to sleep.

item.title: Pension shenanigans
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: The truth about annuity quotes at the moment is that it seems to depend on who you ask, the day that you ask, and whether it's raining. I got full-market quotes from the Money Advice Service and Hargreaves Lansdowne, which both rated Just as the top provider. I then got quotes from Age UK (through Hub FS), which rated Canada Life as top by a good margin. Contacted Hub online, who phoned a couple of days later. Booked an appointment with "Elizabeth" for this morning. Rather dismayed when a man with a heavy Ulster accent called this morning. Lots of requests to "please repeat" and being addressed as "yourself" later, it turns out that today's top quote is Aviva. Abandoned the application. Online annuity quotes from Aviva: 13 Sep 2017 ┬ú5,085.84 09 Oct 2017 ┬ú4,621.68 10 Oct 2017 ┬ú5,000.28 My Aviva personal pension has also dropped ┬ú4k in value over the past 12 months, despite being on a "lifestage investment approach." 75% of my pension is in units of Aviva Long Gilt S6 (which is itself an aggregate of other UK gilts), and which has a risk value of 4/5. This does have its advantages, of course, when things go well:

item.title: Chocolate
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Hungry falling asleep last night, so read Andrew Solomon and Sebastian Faulks on my iPad and ate 4 x Wispas and 4 x Snickas. Slept till 11:45 this morning. Crikey.

item.title: Depression
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: My understanding now after enduring four months of severe depression last winter is that it is a physical illness: my auto-immune system becomes inflamed and my amygdala becomes intensely over-active and unable to respond to calming biochemical signals from other areas of my brain. It's not unusual to experience profound emotional and mental side-effects when your system is constantly flooded with adrenaline. To conflate those with temporary feelings of sadness and/or world-weariness is at best misleading and at worst dangerous. Depression can be a terminal illness and needs to be treated as such. Meditation, medication, and metta bhavana have all helped me. There's an interesting possibility that cytokine therapy may be able to help many sufferers, but research is still at an early stage. Personally, I never found talking therapy such as CBT much help (although it did introduce me to mindfulness). As a recovering addict, I suspect that peer-based talking therapy might be much more useful. I believe the NHS now employs mental health peer-support workers, although these are early days and there are still problems to be ironed out.

item.title: Clumsy
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A funny old day. Feeling clumsy, like when you pick up a box of cornflakes and the bottom falls out. But I've managed to get my MALM chest of drawers upstairs and have sorted out some webserver problems that have been bugging me for a while. I've got WordPress running on localhost using XAMPP, but Movable Type still eludes me. No wonder WordPress has 50% of the blogware market and MT only 0.1%.

item.title: Back
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: My back is giving me a lot of grief today. Perhaps it's the damp weather? Whatever, it's not been a long time (late January this year) since I had my spinal surgery, so it's probably to be expected. Taking extra painkillers helps, but I don't like doing that too often. It's a difficult choice.

item.title: wu-wei
item.dc:creator: phil

item.title: twentyten
item.dc:creator: phil

item.title: Pain
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
The abdominal pain & nausea is back & bad. Lying in bed this morning to wait for it to subside and had an accident. Ugh. Washing my bedclothes and pondering a dry clean for my duvet.

Thought

It has occurred to me that I've been on a reduced daily dose of Mirtazapine (15 mg) since Thursday (16 August). Having an upset digestive system is a known withdrawal symptom.

item.title: Sneakware
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Dropbox has decided that I need to upload all of my phone pictures & movies to the cloud. And delete everything else, including my KeePass database file. Oh and AVG now upgrades with the option to not only install its own browser, but to make it the default. Both option boxes are checked by default and displayed in quite small text.

item.title: Builders
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling out of sorts today. It's wet & grey and my stomach & ankle both hurt. A man came to the door this morning to tell me that there would be building work starting shortly in the Methodist church car park. Great. Well, I've already got a builders yard on one side. Need some nets on the front windows. I can see people passing and they can look in.

item.title: Sleepless
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 03:03 the night before last. but went back to sleep until 06:03. Woke in the dark last night (I guess at around the same time), but couldn't get back to sleep, although I managed to meditate and doze. Up at 07:14, though, and feeling okay at the moment.

item.title: Frustration
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Attempting to get my VOWH Housing Benefit stopped yesterday. You can't do it online - you can can only notify a change of address within the area. Or by phone - after several goes, I ended up at an option that said Press 0 to speak to an adviser. Press 0, message is repeated, along with instructions to use the website.

In the end, I used the wrong option just to speak to somebody and I was rather short with her by this point. It sounded like an Indian call centre (for an Oxfordshire borough!) and she asked me at one point if I wanted to "drop my mobile". Which turned out to mean give her my mobile number. Anyway, it's done now and I'm sure she's had worse encounters.

item.title: Smoking
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Smoking is causing me increasing anxiety now.

The first two cigarettes at 16:00 make my legs and hips go really numb. Also experience agitation and inability to concentrate. It all feels like an anxiety attack.

item.title: Chance
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
A couple of happy coincidences. A couple of days ago, I was drinking coffee and eating fig rolls, browsing the net, and came across a description of Don & Walter in the studio listening to Steely Dan playbacks, drinking coffee and eating "fig newtons". Which turn out to be a type of fig roll...

Then today, checking Donna Tartt's Wikipedia article and researching the term "Ole Miss", then a little while later Starbuck's 1976 hit Moonlight Feels Right came on the radio with its reference to "you came to Baltimore from Ole Miss".

item.title: Ill
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling oddly out of sorts at the moment. Stomach pain & nausea as usual, but also feeling tired and dispirited. Cancelled my X-ray appointment today as I don't feel well enough to travel. although I was looking forward to the trip to Shipley. Awake at 04:06 and dozed fitfully till 06:00, when I took a Nurofen Plus. Lay in bed meditating till just before 09:00, which is lateish for me.

item.title: Achievements
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Not had a cig since last Sunday and managed to complete my application for Housing Benefit after several weeks.

item.title: Low
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Still feeling low, mostly physical. Like coming on with a cold which doesn't actually materialise. Feeling tired; difficulty sleeping; slight headache. Still eating fine, though. Cancelled my hairdressers appointment as I was worried about being too unwell to attend.

item.title: Baildon Library
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Baildon Library is just down the hill from Perseverance Street. When you borrow a book, the librarian stamps a sheet inside the front cover. There are two sheets, one pasted on top of the other, and you can see all the times that Graham Greene's "The Comedians" has been borrowed since 1994.

On my way home, I can see the moor over the top of the Methodist church and my little cottage nestled in the fold close by. Alan Bennett would love it.

item.title: Funny money
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: This morning, I was bemoaning my (apparent) lack of funds and thinking that an extra £100 a month would sort things out nicely. Where's that going to come from, I despaired. Then it occurred to me to do an annual calculation over all the four-weekly incoming payments and seven-fold direct debits. And I ended up with about £130 a month extra.

item.title: Pepper
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: The doc has given me some pepper cream for my ostearthritic ankle. It has to be applied several times a day with a thorough hand wash after each application. Not very pleasant stuff to get in your eyes, for example.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It didn't work. And my ankle isn't arthritic.

item.title: Accomplishments
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I've been feeling mentally and physically not best this past week or so, but I've managed to break up and recycle the old chest of drawers, catalogue Q magazines 100-226, and today finish mending the light fitting in my bedroom. Balanced very carefully on a chair and pausing or stopping at signs of wobble or weakness,

item.title: Blue
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke up feeling low, tearful, and slightly anxious. My ankle hurts as well. So sick of feeling bad all of the time. I had an hour's meditate, which eased it somewhat.

item.title: Larkin
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I borrowed a book of Philip Larkin's letters from the Baildon lending library, which should be interesting reading. That man could have grumped for Britain at the Olympics. And he was a librarian in Hull, which is a nice irony.

item.title: Low
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Feeling very low today, tired, anxious about small things, no appetite for food or anything else, weepy, and I've had an extra Nurofen Plus.

After a period of meditation (45 minutes, at a guess), the low mood lifts and I feel hungry. I wonder if my symptoms are side-effects of the Mirtazapine?

item.title: Sleepless
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another grotty sleepless night, awake from 00:30 to 07:30.

item.title: Larking
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Beginning to feel human again. Slowly. I have started my Hockney sketch again this last week and ordered some lace curtains.

Been reading Philip Larkin's letters to Monica and am amused by some of his dislikes.

  • His noisy neighbour slamming doors
  • A usage "Christopher himself said"
  • "An hotel" wallahs

Then watching a BBC Monitor programme about him from 1964, where the interview with Betjeman has some unnecessary guitar plinking in the background. So that particular documentary feature has been around for, what, 54 years at least.

item.title: Grey
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 04:00. sleepless, up at 06:45. It's a cold, grey day and I feel cold & low. However, it's 10:30 and a 1.5 hour meditation has helped somewhat. A Ranitidine pill bounced off the worktop and has completely disappeared, which made me somewhat anxious. The floor under the worktop is hoovered now, though :-)

item.title: Ankle
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: The osteoarthritic pain in my left ankle seems less when my mood is good & up & positive.

item.title: Moody
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Slept through till 06:00 this morning (although my dreams were of the anxious/worried variety), but woke feeling unwell in my abdomen. Took a Nurofen Plus early and drowsed till just before 09:00. Feeling moody, anxious, a bit weepy, unenthusiastic today. Yesterday was good, though.

I did wonder if it was codeine withdrawals, as I stuck to 48 mg yesterday. Been experiencing dizziness lying in bed as well, which is very odd.

item.title: Joy?
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I wish for some joy in my life. At the moment, all I mostly feel is emotional & physical pain and no prospect of it getting any better. Anxiety is quite soul destroying.

item.title: Fear
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Anxiety starts by worrying about things that need to be worried about. Then you start worrying about things that don't need to be worried about. Then you start worrying about worrying.

The thing about my anxiety is that I worry about a lot of things all at the same time. However, the truth is that situations don't all arise at once, but one at a time. And I'm capable of dealing with every situation as it arises (sometimes with help from the supporters in my life).

item.title: Sad
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Awake at just before 05:00 with a pain in my stomach, gradually developing into a feeling of utter sadness and questioning despair. It's 11:00 now and I've already had three of my strong 12 mg codeine pills. Feeling numb, vacant, and unhappy.

Up at 07:30 after meditating for a couple hours. During my meditation, I had a fleeting feeling that I need this pain in some strange way. That I'm reluctant to give my fear, anxiety, and mental/emotional pain up for some reason.

item.title: Metta
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I read something recently to the effect that metta (compassion) also means goodwill. All of my reasons not to redirect a previous resident's mail are not really goodwill. So if I'm unsure whether to keep on doing it, I guess the default answer is yes.

item.title: Curtains
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
The curtain rod at one end of my bedroom fell down in the middle of the night. I can't fix it and am full of anxiety about contacting landlady Liz to have it fixed. Sleepless since about 02:00 anyway and, despite too much codeine yesterday (84 mg), in so much pain from my ankle that I couldn't read in bed, so went to sleep early anyway.

The curtain rod was a botch job to start with, only fixed by one screw at each end and the weight of my heavy Habitat curtain has pulled the screws out completely.  There are four rather large holes in the wall, which perhaps can be filled, but the rod holders have holes that don't match up with the ones in the wall.

Feeling worried and tearful, jumping at odd sounds. Unable to concentrate, not much appetite (although I'm eating lunch at my computer whilst writing this).

On the plus side, Sarah is leaving hospital today after a four-day stay due to acute colitis. She picked up an unfriendly bug in Africa. It's a relief that she's well.

item.title: Lower
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Feeling low, awake at 03:00 and didn't really get any rest after that. Dr Calaghan says that the x-ray shows that I have osteo-arthritis in my right knee, with space around the joint explaining the wobble.

Reading the Motion biography of Pa Larkin yesterday evening, and he was similarly discomfited & miserable at having to leave his flat after some years. Maybe I'm just an older person having to cope with illness, pain, and moving house and having a fairly normal reaction to all that unwelcome change.

item.title: Tired
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Sorting out my Q magazines, the 1-100 run. It's taking a while because I get tired very easily. So many doubles! I have duplicate copies of issues 38-49, for example. And three copies of issue 55 :-) Mad.

item.title: Rested
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Switched my daily Mirtazapine to nocte a couple of days ago. Felt decidedly wonky yesterday, so had a bit of a duvet day yesterday. Still having fearful & anxious thoughts about landlady, lease & house in general, so had a long (1.5 hours) meditation this morning. Definitely helpful.

item.title: Rituals
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Oh dear. I find myself behaving like all humans do when they're bored and/or lonely: watching the outside world; looking forward to the next drink/food/medication/sleep.

item.title: Improving
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
My sleep is back to a very good level (20:00-05:00) and I can drowse for hours in the morning feeling quite content and rested. Eating well, too. But I still have this restless dread hanging around. It will go eventually, but it's a pain to live with.

As is my ankle, which was so sore last night that I had to cut both my guided meditation and my bedtime read (A Dance to the Music of Time) short. It doesn't hurt when I lie on my side, which is some blessing at least.

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 03:00 last night and must have slept because it seemed to pass quite quickly. Up at 07:15. My ankle hurts now at 10:30, which is early (affected by rain, cold?), and I feel really down in the dumps. No appetite, and have had two cups of coffee and an extra Solpadeine Max this morning. Ugh.

item.title: Pain
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had a pretty sleepless night last night. Caused by anxiety about the increase in pain in my ankle. Curiously, I was up at about 07:20 and feel quite lively, if a bit vacant. The ankle is hurting again mid-morning and it's still raining. Had a 1.5 hour meditation this morning, which definitely helped. Most of the time, my ankle is sore, which is tolerable. But this is over the edge and distressing.

item.title: Appetite
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Felt rotten most of yesterday after waking up early (04:00) in the freezing cold. A grim, cold day of near-freezing fog. No appetite all day, awake at 22:30 (!) and took a Zopiclone. Fearful of the return of severe depression.

item.title: Appetite
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Eating with some relish today after a heavy few days of no appetite (fruit/creme fraiche/Bounty bars only), disturbed sleep (half a Zopiclone for two nights and a whole one for two nights), low mood, and general knackeredness, stomach-ache and anxiety. Yesterday was especially grim: a long afternoon of lying on the sofa meditating.

Saw Dr Burden this morning for an increase to 45mg Zopiclone daily and managed to talk her into giving me 14 Zopiclone. She has recommended diphenhydramine, which I will try whilst I've got some Zopiclone in hand.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The Sleepeaze had no effect, despite taking 2 x 50 mg tablets..

item.title: Duvet day
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Spent most of yesterday (up to about 14:00) lying in bed meditating on my side, as I was continuing to have stomach pain and felt very tired/low. Pretty successful on the whole, as I felt quite peaceful throughout. Some meditation later on the sofa was not so good (sore foot very distracting) and I retreated to bed at about 18:00 with a whole Zopiclone.

Slept fine (only waking once at 00:00 and going back to sleep). Upped my dose of Mirtazapine to 45 mg a few days ago, which may explain the digestive upset.

I spent some lying meditating in the reclining Buddha position (see below). This takes the weight off my sore ankle and is thus more comfortable.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Increased dose 28th

item.title: Painkillers
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: It doesn't seem to matter how much codeine I take, my ankle pain never abates. I'm currently prescribed 60 mg codeine phosphate and I realised yesterday that I was being given exactly the same in February in the JR. So today I took my two half-daily little codeine pills and added 24 mg OTC pills and a 150 mg Ranitidine, just before sitting down for meditation. No difference whatsoever.

item.title: Ankle
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
General

It felt like a rushed consultation with the physio (Virginia Whiteley) and her manner was somewhat abrupt. Overall, similar to my last encounter with Dr Sanders in Abingdon. An impatient health professional presented with a patient with an unusual complaint. She terminated the consultation in a similar way (by telling me that she had another patient to see).

Diagnosis

These are the physio's handwritten notes:

  • Ankle good range movement
  • Normal muscle strength
  • Balance issues - probable nerve damage
  • + sciatic nerve stretch LEFT

She asked to see a discharge letter from neurosurgery in Oxford. With her approval, I supplied three:

  • MRI spine lumbar and sacral final report - 15 Jan 2018
  • Discharge summary - 1 Feb 2018
  • Neurosurgical outpatient's letter - 21 June 2018

My interpretation

My ankle pain isn't necessarily arthritis, but may be neuropathic in origin. Something to do with sciatic nerve stretch and nerve damage.

The JR documents show that my left leg is weaker than the right. This is confirmed by the fact that I can walk on tiptoe on my right foot, but not my left.

My gait is affected as a result, which is putting pressure on my ankle joint (I think).

So it's traumatic rather than degenerative, which explains why lying down eases it  (I think).

Recommendations

  • A neuropathic agent such as Gabapentin
  • Daily Vitamin D3
  • Twice-daily foot/leg exercises

Follow up

The diagnosis puzzled my GP Dr Burden, who said she was reading some "fairly cryptic" notes on my patient record.

Further action

Arrange a further appointment with Dr Burden to discuss possibilities:

  • Have an X-ray
  • Get a second opinion
  • Swap codeine with gabapentin/pregabalin (the latter might be better as I've already taken it with no adverse effects)

item.title: Progress
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
The Mirtazapine upgrade is having an effect. Slept well on half a Zopiclone last night and had a lie in. Took it earlyish, about 8 or 9 o'clock I think. I feel mostly rested today, with very occasional twinges of the anxiety monster. No major lurches or freakouts like yesterday, though. Yet! Eating fine and had a good long 1.5 hour sitting meditation this morning. Looking forward to a drug-free night as I've been taking the Z for a week or so now.

Looking at the YourMove renewal schedule and they say "approximately two months" before the end of the tenancy. There is likely to be a charge. Landlady must give two months notice of eviction, though. It's not likely to happen, though. I'm a good tenant and it would cost her to find a new one. If it did happen, would it be the end of the world? Inconvenient and costly, certainly. But I would look for a smaller/cheaper place with maybe some garden for the summer.

item.title: Reality cheque
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Just looking at my cashflow for December 2004, which has these figures:

Rent650.00
Water rates37.69
Gas/Electric67.00
Council Tax98.00

The only one of these which has increased for me at Binswell Fold 14 years later is the energy, at 70.00 a month. Extraordinary.

Rent650.00
Water rates29.10
Gas/Electric70.00
Council Tax90.00

item.title: Tired
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Tired today, with an aching tummy and lower back, but feeling positive. No Zopiclone last night, but it wasn't too bad. Kind of surfing in and out of dreams all night and I do get a very long rest, probably about 12 hours in total. Now watching Alan Bennett's Diaries doc and eating cold sausage sandwiches.

item.title: Head weather
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Odd weather today. Sunny, then misty, then sunny again. My mood is the same. Had half a Z last night and slept fine, but I feel low this morning. When I sit to meditate, I can feel an area of calm in me and anxiety chattering away as well. Sat at my computer earlier, did my banking & checked my email & Facebook, then thought "What do I do now?" and couldn't think of anything. That was oddly unpleasant, although it does mean that I meditate, which can't be a bad thing. But I feel low and empty and dispirited and full of anxious and critical and fearful thoughts and I'm fed up with it.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: What do I do now? Writing always pleases and settle me still, even after retiring from it as a full-time activity. Wikipedia and this blog form part of my writing activity, but I can't seem to get my teeth into finishing the Dear Dad book of memories that Sarah gave me. It will come, I'm sure. Another activity that pleases and fulfils me is historical research.

item.title: Rain
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: It's raining heavily here in Baildon today, but I'm warm & dry in my little house with a fire lit and a mug of good strong coffee. My mood picked up yesterday and today I feel fine, a little whacked (but I guess that's a symptom of both my illness and the medication used to treat it).

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The house has been lovely & warm since I turned the central heating up to 8.

item.title: Update
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Been sleeping without Zopiclone for, what, three nights now? It feels like a lot longer. Awake at 03:00 last night but dozed till I got up at 07:30. So tired yesterday that I stayed in bed till (gasp) 15:00. The time went quite fast meditating, it didn't drag and I wasn't consumed with anxiety. Got up, had a cup of tea, then a couple of Bounty bars and eight poppadoms, then played my guitar. Still very tired today, but in more of a kind of knocked-out relaxed way.

item.title: Draughts
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake in the night (at say 03:00) to feel a draught of cold air on my face. Didn't really get back to sleep. It looks as though the seal around the double glazing frame has become detached (like the seal on the door in the living room below), enough to allow a small stream of air. Possibly useful in summer, but enough to make the bedroom cold overnight. Especially when the wind speed is around 40 mph overnight.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Thinking of moving my bed to the small room. That's the bedroom with no curtain rail, by the way. A sheet of cardboard at the window will do temporarily.

item.title: Sleep
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A bit fed up with waking at 03:00, so took half a Zopiclone a couple of nights ago. It made absolutely no difference. Last night, I slept right through till about 06:00 without any help.

item.title: Synchronicity
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Came out of my afternoon meditation yesterday to see the cover of the book I'm reading
 (Alan Bennett's "Writing Home") in front of my eyes, with the cover reflecting my meditation posture precisely.

A couple of other recent synchronicities: reading about "Valley Girl" in the Zappa bio and it comes up on a Chris Bent playlist on Towards The Unknown Region; the Zappa bio includes a reference to James A Baker, an erstwhile US Secretary of State whose Wikipedia article I had been researching earlier.

item.title: Painting
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Today I did some art painting for the first time in a long time. I bought the paints in Birmingham (around 1998) and have saved them till the time was right. Which it was today.

item.title: Energy
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Felt a little low yesterday, getting anxious over tiny things such as the screen lock on my computer. Awake at 01:33, anxious dreams. Got up and took the remaining codeine pill from my daily four. Maybe this not a good time to start coming off the codeine (I'm still titrating up the Pregabalin).

Felt restless, but I got back to sleep fine and got up willingly just after 07:00. I had a long morning meditation (1.5 hours, I think). It's lunch-time now and I have a good appetite and lots of energy. This afternoon, I may change my guitar strings and learn the James Taylor song Wandering. Or continue formatting & writing my Dear Dad book. Or do some jigsaws. Or paint a little. It's all good.

item.title: 24 December 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had a very long morning meditation this morning: 08:15-09:45. It was semi-dark when I started and bright sunshine when I finished. Experiencing disturbed sleep and abdominal pain for the last couple of days and have had extra codeine in the form of 8 mg co-codamol. The uncertainty about the lease is causing me anxiety.

item.title: Lease
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Popped in to see Kadie at YourMove this morning to check on the lease renewal. As I suspected, Liz is saving money by not paying fees for a renewal, but going on to a rolling basis. She does this with all her properties, apparently. No problem for me, as it means the rent isn't going up next month. She'll arrange for a renewal of the lease when she wants to increase the rent. I also had a look in the window of Maxwells and there were at least three properties available that I would gladly consider. Including one on East Parade with a cottage garden which looked rather nice. At £565 a month as well. So my fear of moving is reduced.

item.title: Eyes
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I've been on the Pregabalin for a little while now (300 mg a day at present) and not only does it do nothing for my neuropathic pain, it makes me a bit giddy and worst of all gives me really dry/red eyes. It's just as bad away from my computer as on it and eye drops offer limited relief. It gets quite unbearable by the end of the day, so that I'm quite glad to get to bed and not have my eyes open.

item.title: Tearful
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I have felt unusually tearful and anxious the past couple of days. Sleeping fine but had difficulty getting up. Post-Christmas blues? Or is it this blasted Pregabalin again?

item.title: Bath
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Been reducing my Pregabalin 75 mg a week. Started on 150 mg daily yesterday. Feeling vaguely human today after two weeks feeling rotten. No appetite, no energy, feeling anxious. This morning I had a Badedas bath and washed my hair for the first time in about three weeks. Still feeling very wobbly, so I shall postpone going out (even to Westgate Stores).

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Updated my annual spending spreadsheet using the increased figures for personal & state pensions and my housekeeping allowance is actually £405 a month. So there is plenty of room for a Bulb increase to £93 or whatever. I have been stressing a lot about the difficulty and potential cost of keeping this old draughty townhouse warm, so this reality check is a relief. I shall check my sums tomorrow just to be safe, though.

item.title: Wind
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Decided to stop the Pregabalin completely yesterday rather than finish tapering off. A restless night not helped by the sound of gale-force winds whipping around the house all night and the sound of my neighbour coughing. There is a stone wall separating us but the loft space must be shared.

Awake this morning to find my recycling bin tipped over by the 50 mph wind and a good deal of the contents spread out across my neighbour's front space. Started feeling increasingly grotty as the day wore on (again not helped by my Ocado delivery being late enough to cause rising anxiety) and took 75 mg Pregabalin at about 12:00, followed by a Nurofen Plus at 13:00. I shall resume tapering off as planned. My ankle hurts like billy-o and I feel completely lethargic. Fed up all round.

item.title: Light
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: The latest episode in the saga of this mad old house is that the bright intruder light on the wall of the builders is now permanently on during the hours of darkness. It shines into my living room (which isn't so bad, if a little distracting) and into the small bedroom (which doesn't have a curtain or even a rail). It flickers on and off , which is very distracting when I'm trying to sleep. I spent a little while last night propping the cardboard box I have blocking the window with magazines and boxes. Perhaps I can move the curtain rail from the big bedroom. It has the same holes for the fixtures, I think. Feeling yuck. Light snow is promised for this evening.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The light wasn't on last night and hasn't been before, so hopefully it was a one off. The snow really was light. A few flurries, nothing settled. Can't move the rail, as it has a 2.5 cm gap between the screw holes and the existing holes in the small bedroom are 3 cm apart.

item.title: Candle
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I forgot to blow the candle out last night. Fortunately it was fairly low and on a glass top, but it's not good. I shall have to do without until I'm feeling more compos mentis. Haven't really eaten properly for a while now, apart from a whole pork pie with mustard a couple of days ago.

item.title: Dream
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I had a drowsing dreamlet this morning that I was sharing a house with two women and a man. The women were both my lovers and they and the man were very loving and supportive, one of the women telling me how nice it was to live and work with me. I don't really get that kind of support in my life. The path of a monk is sometimes a lonely one.

item.title: Light (again)
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
The bright intruder light came on in the middle of last night, flashing on and off erratically. I spent about ten minutes putting my cardboard shutter in place and fell asleep again.

Spent most of today in or on my bed feeling utterly energy-less and mildly but persistently anxious. Took two extra 12 mg cocodamol as well, which is not ideal. Today is my first day off the pregabalin. Yesterday was fine, lots of energy & appetite, which I guess must mean that I stabilise after a week on a changed dose.

item.title: Rough
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling worse than ever, to be honest. Nervousness, mood disturbances, flu-like symptoms, yes. Still tired at 14:00, no appetite, even after sleeping for ages at night and resting in bed in the morning.

item.title: Money
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling better than yesterday, although still rough overall. Get an optical migraine every day and feel weepy. Good news on the money front, though. All that not eating means that I've only spent £206 on housekeeping this month. That means that I won't go into the red before my high month of May.

item.title: Sleep
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: To bed at 17:40 last night. Meditated & dozed until 23:00, when I got up and took a Nurofen Plus. Slept through until just before 06:00, when I got up and took my morning 30 mg codeine. Meditated & dozed until 10:30, when I got up.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: One of the big advantages of getting that much rest is that my ankle doesn't hurt when I'm lying down.

item.title: Sleep?
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A broken night last night. Couldn't get to sleep properly and got up three times for meds (a Nurofen Plus at 22:30, half a Zopiclone at 01:00, then a Solpadeine Max at 03:00). The light flashing was very distracting even with the screen in place and I could hear someone moving about next door for what seems like most of the night. Ugh. Earplugs in and out

item.title: More grot
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
To bed at 18:40 last night. Meditated & dozed until 23:30, when I got up and took a Nurofen Plus. Slept through until just before 06:00, when I got up and took my morning 30 mg codeine. No mysterious mouse noises from next door and no flashing lights. So far, so good.

Unable to get up until 14:30, when my ankle was hurting badly enough for me to need distraction. Took two extra Solpadeine Max during the day, evenly spaced. Able to meditate quite well (probably helped by the codeine). By that I mean that my mind isn't rushing. But I do have the odd anxious thought and I can feel the effeect it has on my nervous system and my body. So the calmness doesn't really "take", as it were.

item.title: 4 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Up at 11:00 after a bit of a broken night, but had a good doze/meditate this morning and feel in quite good spirits now at 13:00.

item.title: Retreat
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Up at 17:20 yesterday after spending three days in bed. No food, no liquids apart from water, just lots (and lots) of rest & meditation. Took a midday dose of two Solpadeine Max on a couple of days. Surprisingly good sleep, considering, although it was restless (despite taking a night-time Nurofen Plus at about 21:00 and half a Zopiclone at 23:00). I slept through till 06:00 one night.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: At the time of writing, I have nausea, a sore foot, and arthritic pain in my arms & hands. Feeling a bit miserable considering. Tried eating a few grapes earlier at 14:00 or so, but they didn't take. Odd really, because at this time yesterday I was having food & drink fantasies (spag bol & Dr Pepper, to be precise).

item.title: 9 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Felt really bad yesterday, panicky and depressed. I've had stomach pain and nausea for three days now and haven't eaten anything as a result. Had a rather broken night, but did manage to get some rest (with the aid of two 15 mg codeine phosphate). Seeing my GP next Wednesday.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I cooked some potato curry and rice and made bananas with sugar and creme fraiche. Only had a few mouthfuls of the curry and rice as I feared getting raging heartburn again. It was nice and tasty, though.
And I have just had a sit-down shave.
Followed by some more curry and rice, some bananas with creme fraiche, and two Bounty bars to come.

item.title: 10 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had a good night's sleep (with the aid of two 15 mg codeine phosphate). Woke up with the nauseous, low feeling in my stomach. No reason to get up and enjoy the day as I have nothing to do (apart from the washing). The truth is that some of my best days are unplanned and ordinary activities can be quite pleasurable when my mood is good. This is a persistent sour feeling. Everything grates. No joy.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Mid-afternoon, I have eaten a proper day's food (for me!) and now have bad heartburn. That may be a result of overload after a fair time without food, to be honest.

Had a long two-hour meditation sitting on the sofa and am fairly well convinced that my sickness over the past month or so is the pain/nausea that was plaguing me a couple of years ago. I had investigations of my colon, but never my stomach.
On the medication side of things, I see from my calendar that I took 48 mg co-codamol on 27 March 2016. I'm on a base of 60 mg now, which is not bad for a three year period.

item.title: Jane
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I am curiously obsessed at the moment with the whereabouts of my old friend Jane Hunt. Like many of our generation, she seems to have a minimal net presence. That's odd, as I remember showing her how to use Netscape back in about 1995.

item.title: Switch
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Switching to Venlafaxine, titrating down to 30 mg Mirtazapine for a week first. Expect to feel somewhat sleepless and otherwise queasy. Mood definitely lifted by Sarah's visit yesterday, though.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Yes, sleep disturbed a bit (but remediable by extra codeine) and feeling a bit weak (can only walk around the corner), but mood definitely up. The sun shines into the house in the afternoon, which is very pleasant. Eating well, with the heartburn to show for it! Oh well.

item.title: 15 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: About to enjoy some home-made food (spicy carrot soup, banana bread with creme fraiche) courtesy of my daughter and investigating Digital Champion volunteer opportunities in my area. The weather today is sunny with a gentle breeze.

item.title: Energy
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Paranoid about the cost of my energy consumption, I took gas/electricity readings 27 January, but didn't submit them or calculate the cost. I did the calculation today and it came to £114.70. Bulb calculated it to be £123.08. Excellent.

item.title: Sleep-in
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I have been feeling decidedly cheerful since last Wednesday and slept through without taking any extra codeine last night.

item.title: 23 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Down to 15 mg Mirtazapine since Wednesday. Difficulty getting restful sleep and my stomach hurts at the end of the day. That all makes me feel less than brilliant and a bit confused, although my mood in general is improved.

item.title: 25 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Had half a Zopiclone last night and slept through until just before 04:00, which is good. Woke with stomach pain & nausea, though, which is a bit grim. Took my morning codeine at 06:00 and was up at 07:20 needing the loo.

I'm finding it increasingly difficult to distinguish my mood from my physical health. When my stomach hurts, I feel dispirited, anxious & low. And when my mood is low or dark, my ankle hurts more.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Been to the loo twice today, unusually given my usual constipation. It's 16:05 now and my tummy hurts so much that I've had an extra Solpadeine Max and just now 30 mg codeine phosphate. Ugh. It's a lovely spring today and I feel so grotty that I've haven't been able to move from the sofa except to my PC.

Last night pretty much the same. Tired today, low energy, nauseous but no tummy pain yet, some appetite. Standard Mirtazapine withdrawal, methinks. https://www.therecoveryvillage.com/remeron-addiction/withdrawal-detox/#2
Headache Anxiety Irritability Fatigue Insomnia

item.title: 27 February 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another restless night, took extra codeine yesterday & at night but no Zopiclone, up at 07:00, then started feeling really bad, sweats, fatigue, aching. Took my remaining half 30 mg Mirtazapine tablet, meditated for about two hours, and now feel fine.

item.title: 2 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: It's been a bad couple of days. Depressed, anxious, tired even after taking half a Zopiclone at night and sleeping eight hours, no appetite at all, and my ankle hurts like billy-o from about 10:00 (instead of from about 16:00 normally). Having strange, violent thoughts/dreamlets and making the odd strange mistake (like the message I wrote Adam about ancestors living abroad). Fearful of the severe depression returning. But I felt as right as rain about a week ago!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Some of my symptoms (including muscle pain and back pain) are listed as side-effects in the information leaflet. It takes a while for the medication to take effect (1-2 weeks), so I may be experiencing a combination of withdrawal symptoms and side-effects of it working again. Mirtazapine has a powerful effect on me, I'm sure.

item.title: Surprise
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: To bed at 18:30 last night, with my ankle as sore as it's ever been after hurting all day. After an hour, took half a Zopiclone praying that it would send me to sleep and give me some relief. It did. Woke at 03:00, thinking that I would be meditating till getting up and my ankle hurting in the meantime and I went back to sleep. Until 05:30, when I took my morning codeine and dozed/meditated. Up just before 08:00.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: My morning meditation worked, as well. Focussing on accepting and letting go of negative thoughts, mainly about myself. Thoughts of envy of other people's lives and the "failures" of mine. Getting twinges of the jhana feeling in my tummy. The early morning can definitely be a time of great negativity, fear, and doubt for me. Finding it helpful as well at the moment to "keep it in the day" as well as I can. But feeling better overall today than yesterday.
Yesterday, I had a message exchange with Sarah (who has been suffering too recently), washed my feet and trimmed my nails, and had a sit-down shave.

item.title: 4 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Same regime last night as previous, but woke at (I think) 02:00 and didn't get back to sleep. Up at 07:45 after worrying about Zopiclone running out and pondering buying some off the internet. Checked the surgery appointment page just before 09:00 and on a whim decided to make an appointment for 10:10 with a different GP (Dr Cynthia W Kennedy). Who saw me promptly, diagnosed extended withdrawal symptoms, and advised staying on 30 mg for a further three weeks. We can evaluate my progress then and consider moving to Venlafaxine. She also gave me a new scrip for Zopiclone after a short discussion and will renew it as necessary.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I decided to see a different GP after considering the variation in prescribing practice that I've encountered. This is not "shopping around" if the medication is beneficial and both GP and patient understand and agree the risks/benefits balance.

item.title: Mend?
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Started eating yesterday and visited a couple of chemists after seeing the GP. Slept through till 05:00 this morning. Still a bit droopy (low mood, spaced out, unable to concentrate, no interest in anything) but on the mend, I think.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hmm... it's 15:20 and I feel pretty grotty. My ankle hurts. My tummy hurts. My arthritic right knee feels sore. It's going to be another Zopiclone night, I suspect.

It was a Zopiclone night (a half these days), but I managed to delay taking it until around 23:30. Didn't plan to, just kept resting and meditating and it felt good, no distressing/distracting pain in my ankle, and had a Nurofen Plus at about 20:00. This is a good sign. Awake just before 06:00 and up at 07:30.

item.title: 7 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Another half a Zopiclone night, but I managed to delay taking it until 00:00. Had a Nurofen Plus at about 20:00. This is a good sign. Awake just before 05:00 and up at 07:45.

Out to the Co-op for a big shop yesterday and a nice chat with Suni in the corner shop. They stock frozen meals, which I hadn't realised.

In the afternoon, spent some time looking up old Cambridge work colleagues and writing a series of Facebook posts about my illness.

item.title: Blue
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: I've had a good couple of days being active, getting out of the house, eating & sleeping well, and today I woke up feeling blue. Still do after some coffee, cheese & crackers and my normal morning activities. Just tearful, can't concentrate properly, can't get warm, no enthusiasm, worried that I'm going blind because my right eye feels a bit sore.

item.title: 9 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another half a Zopiclone night, but I managed to delay taking it until 23:30. Had a Nurofen Plus at about 20:00.  Awake at 06:30 and up at 07:45. It's a very wet and grey morning, but I feel okay.

item.title: 10 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
A night without any Zopiclone and slept through till 06:00. Meditated until 08:30, but feel a bit lacklustre - slight pains in cheekbone, stomach, and knee - and with that feeling of dread somewhere in the background. On the whole, though, on the mend.

Ate like a horse yesterday, updated my iTunes music library (and fixed a problem with the playlist view), and found some alternative/additional versions of my physio exercises. Which I started doing about three days ago, just a couple twice a day at first, then building up to the full set. Doing them helps psychologically at least.

Beginning to enjoy life again. Reading my school reports for 1969/70 yesterday. Something went pear-shaped in 1970. Started drinking? Parents' divorce? Or just fed up with school by then. I wanted to join the counter-culture, not go to university. The irony is that when I did finally apply to go to uni, my exam results didn't matter one bit. At least, I don't remember anyone ever asking me about them. They were good enough to put on a CV in later years, although I doubt that their veracity was ever checked. I put my Additional Maths result in complete with the grade: F for Fail! Naughty.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Suddenly gripped by panic as it starts to snow large flakes at 11:00. Power cuts! No shopping delivery!
Had a foot bath with Badedas yesterday as well. My feet are in good shape.
Talking of feet, my right big toe is sore. It was bothering me and I realised that it may be a good sign i.e. getting feeling back in my feet may mean that the nerves are healing.

item.title: Talents
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Talents that I've used in employment and which I enjoy:

  • Helping people - face to face - shop work (John Temple, White Rabbit, Our Price, Ladbrokes)
  • Helping people - teaching - seminar work, pronunciation coaching
  • Helping people - at a distance - writing user assistance
  • Writing - I got an A for English Language at O level - writing user assistance
  • Design - I got an A for Art at O and A level - designing user assistance
  • Working pro bono - Carers Directory, Wikipedia

School education didn't really help substantially with those careers, except for things that I have a natural talent for (art, English). I didn't discover linguistics until about 1975 and I knew immediately that that was what I wanted to go to university to study. And in the course of trying to write a PhD, discovered personal computers. In 1970, neither of those options was really available. Linguistics was never mentioned at school and personal computers hadn't been invented.

So my sense of being swept along by events in my life is a little misleading. It was a series of happy accidents rather than some kind of chaotic meandering from one thing to another with no real direction or purpose. That latter is my monkey mind's view of things.

item.title: 11 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: What a strange and unpleasant night. Meditated, took Zantac & Nurofen Plus, dozed but still not properly asleep. At 00:00, checked the clock and debated whether to take half a Zopiclone as I had the alarm set for 08:30 to get up in time for my Ocado delivery this morning. Finally took it, took my earplugs out, and found myself awake and stressing about all and everything in the middle of the night. After a while of trying to get back to sleep, checked the clock and it was just before 06:00. I thought I'd been awake all night and that the Z hadn't worked. I'm very up and down at the moment.

item.title: 12 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A Zopiclone-free night yesterday, although I woke at about 04:00 and didn't go back to sleep. Dozed fine, though, then meditated from 06:00 to 08:00.

item.title: 14 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another Zopiclone-free night yesterday and got a good night's rest. Had half a Z the night before.

item.title: 15 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another Zopiclone-free night yesterday.  Awake at 05:00 with the abdominal pain and the fear & anxiety running through my head. It gradually passes as I doze & meditate. Up at 07:30.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Still feeling fairly anxious at almost 11:00. The wind is high (50 mph), there's parcel tape round the back door, and Landlady Liz will be sealing the leaky big bedroom back window some time soon.
Feeling hot & tired with a stomach ache at 15:30. Are these symptoms a result of feeling anxious or the other way round?

item.title: 16 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another half a Zopiclone night, but I managed to delay taking it until 23:30. Had a Nurofen Plus at about 20:00.  Awake at 05:00 and up at 08:15. The time from 05:00 to 06:00 passed in a flash: very odd.

item.title: 17 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another half a Zopiclone night, as yesterday.  Awake at 05:00 and up at 07:30.  I am aware of a kind of constant low-level fear & anxiety, though. Feel cold all the time as well.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: On the plus side, I'm only taking 75 mg ranitidine a day, as opposed to 150 mg previously. And I'm just at the end of a Zopiclone prescription (14 tablets) issued 28 November 2018. Not bad.

item.title: 18 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A disturbed night. Took my Nurofen Plus as usual at 20:00, but was awake at 01:30 feeling quite agitated. Took half a Z, but was awake again at 04:00. Managed to doze & meditate until 06:00, when I took my morning codeine. Up at 07:15.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Have been troubled by persistent unkind thoughts about my ex son-in-law. May try some metta bhavana on him. Also spent a good deal of time yesterday wrestling with renaming my Leeds photos. My ankle hurt quite a lot when I was meditating and falling asleep. It seemed more irksome than usual.
8-17 March, Zopiclone 3.75 mg 0 mg 3.75 mg 0 mg 3.75 mg 0 mg 0 mg 3.75 mg 3.75 mg 3.75 mg

item.title: 19 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another disturbed night, but Zopiclone free. Took my Nurofen Plus as usual at 20:00, but was awake at 02:00. Awake again at 04:00. Managed to doze & meditate until 05:00, when I took my morning codeine. Up at 07:10.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Felt pretty crummy all day, although I ate as usual. Decided not to put the recycling bin out for collection, which caused me some anxiety. It doesn't really matter either way, to be honest.

item.title: 20 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another disturbed night. Took my Nurofen Plus as usual at 20:00, but was awake at 02:00. Took half a Z, but seemed to be awake for the rest of the night. Managed to doze & meditate until 06:00, when I took my morning codeine. Up at 07:45.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Felt really anxious all morning. Spent some time hiding Mikey's photos and fruitlessly trying identify the cause of PhotoRenamer reporting a number of photo files (for example, Leeds - 1 November 2002 06.jpg) as “Exif Date Not Available”. Decided it was a bug in the end and not worth the time & effort in fixing. Had a long (1.5 hour) meditation this morning, wishing Mikey, Adam & Sarah well.

item.title: 21 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling tired after two disturbed nights, so took a whole Zopiclone at 20:00. Woke briefly a couple of times in the night, then awake at just before 05:00. Not sure if I feel better today. I'm getting really fed up with my mood going all over the place and with taking so many unpredictable chemicals.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I wonder how "well & happy" I'm going to feel in general given the following: * A new house to get used to - strange leaks, no curtain rails, for example * Limited mobility - no ability to go for a long walk, so stuck in the house a lot of the time * Constant pain - it's no fun and is bound to darken my mood

item.title: 22 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Another disturbed night. Took half a Z at 20:00, but was awake at 02:00. Seemed to be awake for the rest of the night. Managed to doze & meditate until 05:40, when I took my morning codeine. Up at 07:45.

During that time awake before getting up, I meditate lying on my back, with my arms and hands above the duvet. I am usually full of anxiety and focus on accepting my fear, and then letting go of it. A suitable meditation period for me seems to be 45 minutes minimum and 1.5 hours maximum.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: In the early evening, I find myself reading some James Herriott vet stories and guffawing out loud.

item.title: 23 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Tried to have a night off the Z, but was still awake after a couple of hours, so got up and took a half tablet. Awake at 03:20. Took my codeine at 05:20, up at 07:50.

item.title: 24 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another Zopiclone-free night yesterday. Awake at some point, but dozed until 05:44, when I started to meditate. Abdominal pain & anxiety as usual. Up at 08:08.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Feeling really rubbish after a good day yesterday, shaky, anxious, no energy or appetite. Worrying about GitHub of all things and examining the series of commits & reverts that I made back in November 2017. That seems like so long ago now. It was part of the learning process, I committed successfully the change I wanted to make, and was thanked for it. The only person even vaguely interested in that series of commits & reverts is me.
* Sudden onset of anxiety * No appetite, no energy * Shaky, weepy, anxious, unable to concentrate * Feeling hot & cold Zopiclone withdrawal symptoms?
Those are all symptoms of clinical anxiety. Along with stomach pain & nausea, which I also suffer from. Also, I've had seven 7.5 Zopiclone since seeing my GP three weeks ago.

item.title: 25 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Tried to have a night off the Z, but was still restless after a couple of hours, so took a half tablet. Awake at 02:30 feeling really anxious about something I was dreaming about. Took my codeine at 05:45, up at 07:50.

item.title: 26 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A Zopiclone-free night yesterday. Awake at some point, but dozed until 05:44, when I took my codeine and started to meditate. Abdominal pain & anxiety as usual. Up at 07:16.

item.title: 27 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
No Nurofen Plus, took a half Zopiclone at 20:00, awake at 23:30,
took another half Zopiclone , slept through till 05:00, codeine & meditation. Experienced a brief (a few minutes) episode of crossed-eyes on getting up at 06:50. A bit worrying. This must be due to the Venlafaxine. It also seems to ease my ankle pain, which would be nice. My eyes are also a bit redder than normal, although the codeine may have caused some of that.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Didn't eat yesterday apart from a couple of Bounty bars in the evening. No food yet today and no appetite. Feeling slightly mauseous the whole time.

item.title: 28 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
No Nurofen Plus, took a half Zopiclone at 20:00, awake at 00:30, 
took another half Zopiclone, slept through till 05:00, codeine & meditation.  Up at 06:50.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Didn’t eat yesterday at all. Just tea & coffee.

Spent part of the day lying on my bed. In the sun! But don't want to get dehydrated, as I was sweating a fair bit. Just taken a half 15 mg Mirtazapine. These withdrawal symptoms are unbearable for more than a couple of days. https://www.newscientist.com/article/2140106-people-are-hacking-antidepressant-doses-to-avoid-withdrawal/

item.title: 29 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Got up at 14:30 after staying in bed all day. Drank a pot of tea, then brushed & trimmed my hair, cleaned my teeth, then had a sit-down shave. Feeling a lot better now and trying to find a radio station to meet my exacting musical demands :-) Scott Walker seems to have died while I was withdrawing this week: sad.

Not the Detroit Emeralds again :-( And if you're going to play some Hendrix, why is it always Watchtower? And what's that whiney overarticulated drivel from someone called Dean Lewis?

The clocks go back on Sunday. Hmm... time to move my bed into the big bedroom. Less mucking about with window screens and earplugs, possibly.

It was a nice sunny day lying in bed at least. My ankle was well-behaved for most of the time. In fact, it hurting was the reason I got up. It hurts now, quite a lot.

item.title: 30 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Took a half Zopiclone at 20:00, still awake at 20:30, 
so took another half Zopiclone. Slept through till 02:00, took a Nurofen Plus, awake at 04:00. took a Solpadeine Max.  Codeine at 06:00, stayed in bed until 11:30, and took four more assorted co-cos in that time. Ugh.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Food!

  • Eight poppadoms
  • Co-Op spag bol
  • Creme fraiche with grapes & chopped banana
  • A couple of Bounty bars
All topped off with a 150 mg ranitidine, just in case.

item.title: 31 March 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Took a half Zopiclone at 20:00, still awake at 20:30, 
so took another half Zopiclone. Didn't feel like I was going to sleep, but I slept through till 05:44. No codeine at night. Woke up feeling rested and pleasant.

item.title: 1 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
A bad start to the night. Got very stressed about the clock change, which I thought meant going to bed in the dark again. Also had bad heartburn from eating a lot of bangers & mash for lunch. It took three 150 mg ranitidine to calm it. Also took a Solpadeine Max at the same time to try and ease the pain. Had an absolutely mad thought about being stuck like this and having to top myself to get out of it. Very scary and not a routine thought for me. A combination of Mirtazapine withdrawal and having that much acid in my stomach, which feels like panic.

Took a half Zopiclone at 20:00, still awake at 20:30, so took another half Zopiclone. Woke at about 02:00 and took a Nurofen Plus. Woke up at 06:00 feeling rested and pleasant. It was such a nice feeling that I stayed in bed and meditated on it until it faded, which was about 09:15. This is a warm, relaxed, solid feeling in the top of my stomach just below my ribs, in exactly the place where I feel the anxiety pain & nausea.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I don't think this pleasant sensation was entirely due to the codeine, as it doesn't have that effect normally. It probably helps.

I've just been to the corner shop for coal, milk, curry & cheesecake. That counts as well, I think, although I didn't feel energetic enough to visit anywhere else. Maybe tomorrow if the weather permits. So that's 4-5 days recovery for this round of titrating down (7.5 mg reduction of Mirtazapine).

item.title: 2 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Took a Nurofen Plus at 20:00, and then half a Z some time later (before midnight, I think), and slept right through until 06:45, when I took my morning codeine. Up at 08:30. This is good after a week on full tablets. Maybe sleeping in my new bed arrangement (big room, bed to the side) helped? It's a little bit cold compared to the box room, but that's part of the reason I've moved so that's not a huge problem. I've discovered that I can rest the bottom of the huge heavy curtain on the huge windowsill and wrap the edges of the curtain to the edges of the big window frame. It cuts out light leakage and any draught coming through the wonky double-glazing unit.

And this morning, worried again about a cold draught coming through the back door frame, I have sealed it with masking tape (rather than parcel tape). It won't be waterproof, but it stops the draught, is easy to get off, and doesn't leave a sticky dark residue.

And I have been watching Amongst White Clouds (2005), a documentary about Buddhist hermits living in the Chinese mountains. One of them (Amitabha) talks about confronting demons, which are creations of the thinking mind. And the benefits and drawbacks of living alone and meditating a lot. It feels familiar. And they talk about the benefits of great suffering, which I find hard to accept. At the moment.

item.title: 3 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Took a Nurofen Plus at 20:00, then half a Z some time later. Woke at 23:30 and took another half and slept until 06:15. Forgot to take my morning codeine in bed. Up at 07:30.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Got very stressed yesterday about putting my recycling bin out. Worried about it disappearing. Decided to try putting it at the top of the fold with the church bins at 17:30. When I checked at 07:50 this morning, it had been collected, no problem, standing neatly arranged with the other bins. I'll continue to put the rubbish bin at the bottom as it's too heavy to pull up the hill and it's not likely to be taken by someone else.
Feeling flat again today, no energy or appetite (although I'm getting things done and will eat fish fingers & chips for lunch). Stressing about messaging Sarah.
I have just moved the small space heater into the big bedroom and tightened up the screws on the power point and I am sweating a fair bit. Not a lot of physical energy at the moment.

item.title: 5 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
A fairly grim couple of days. More codeine than food, in bed resting a lot of the time. Got very stressed yesterday about emails from Bulb about fitting a smart meter. That seems like a lot of hassle (three hours?) for no benefit to me that I can see. Their estimates are pretty close to the mark and I give them a reading every three months. They're trying to cut down on the cost of employing meter readers presumably.
Been taking half a Z at 20:00, then another half when I wake at 23:30 , Awake at 03:30 last night but turned over and went back to sleep until 05:00, when I take my morning codeine in bed.
Up at 11:45 today. Done the washing up and put a small wash on. My left ear is a little blocked, so I need to cut down on using my earplugs. They fit my ear canal too well :-)
Still very jumpy & anxious all the time, but I think the worst is over. 9-10 days to adjust to a change in Mirtazapine dosage seems to be confirmed. I really can't face going through this another three times (22.5 > 15 > 7.5 > 0) and will discuss with Dr Kennedy other ways of coming off, such as switching medications. Seeing another GP (Dr Samina Khalil) on Monday for a refill as I will run out before seeing Dr Kennedy 18 April.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I've just spent half an hour looking for a sock that went missing in the wash. It turned out to be in the pocket of a pair of shorts. Which I where I must have absent-mindedly put it some time in the last week. Phew! It was a white star sock, as well, which I prefer to the blue ones.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Mirtazapine at 18:20, half a Z at 20:00, awake when? maybe 01:00 after seeing a brief bright flash of light and an announcement about living and dying both coming from God, took second half a Z, awake at when? 05:00 feeling no pain. Waited for the grotty feeling to arise, but it hasn't so far today after doimg jobs round the house this morning, followed by an epic shopping trip with Sarah, then lunch at Nine. My appetite is back. In the charity shop, bought a maroon t-shirt, a fruit bowl, a Logitech keyboard (which turned out to be dodgy, got a refund) and a grey lampshade for the small bedroom. I now have flowers at the front of the house and two more house-plants. Sarah bought a lovely wool coat for £20 which apparently cost £1200 originally. Beginning to feel human again.

item.title: 9 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Sunday & Monday, another grim couple of days. Extra codeine, no food, in bed resting most of the time. Ugh.

item.title: 10 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Bit of a panic yesterday. Had a doctor's appointment at 16:40 booked to try and sort out the problem with me feeling so lousy for so long. By 14:30, I was beginning to doubt that I could safely walk up the hill to the surgery, so rang Sarah & left a voicemail. She rang me back five minutes later and arrived just in time to set off. She is an absolute wonder. It was also useful for her to be in on the consultation for her information.
Anyway, Dr Kennedy recommended upping Mirtazapine dose to last stable state (30 mg), has arranged a blood test tomorrow to check for anything malign, and will investigate a slow titration. I'm seeing her next Monday for a follow-up.
Still feeling flattened, but have eaten a bacon sandwich today and done my washing. I hurt all over, though: left ankle & lower leg, right arthritic knee, and the surgery scar is sore again. I guess my auto-immune system is on high alert. I feel very tired both physically and mentally but strangely optimistic. The only way is up, I guess. I have a good feeling somewhere in the pit of my stomach underneath all the layers of pain.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I felt reasonably okay just a while ago (end of March, beginning of April), so I can return to that. On 1 April, I woke up at 06:00 feeling rested and pleasant. And the sun is shining today.

Dr Kennedy also gave me another Zopiclone scrip, so I now have plenty in hand (23 tablets) and no need to worry about running out, even taking a whole 7.5 mg every night as I've been doing.
Last night was a little disturbed. I took my split dose (20:00, 23:30), but was awake at 02:30. Took a couple of Solpadeine Max and managed to drowse until just before 06:00, when I took my morning codeine. That didn't feel pleasant, though. Medicating my feelings? Up at 07:30, though in good spirits so I guess I had a forgotten sleep somewhere in the night.

item.title: 11 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another disturbed night. I took my split dose (20:00, 23:30), but was awake at 02:30. With tummy pain. Ugh. Took a couple of Solpadeine Max and managed to drowse until just before 05:00, when I took my morning codeine. Up at 07:55.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Had a bath, went for my blood test appointment, then decided to do some errands within easy walking distance. Went to Boots, sat in the town square for ten minutes in the sunshine, got some cash out of the Post Office, then went to get my hair cut. Discussed my haircut at some length with Franco the barber and now have it cut the way I wanted all along - a number 3 all over, basically. He said he will remember that and only charged me £7 instead of the usual £8. Presumably because it took less time than all that complicated clipping he used to do before. I have just had some chicken biryani, but mostly ate the rice and left it half-finished. It's best to be cautious after several days without any solid food. Although I did have a bacon sandwich yesterday.

Light bulb moment: I need to see people and I need fresh air. It's okay (and probably good) to be happy with my own company, but I get really sick and miserable after too long in the house. Especially with extra stressors such as a new house to adjust to and some major physical health problems with my legs. Investigate:
  • support group
  • art classes
  • volunteering
Add seeing family to that list. And contact with groups can include:
  • NA
  • Breathwork groups
  • Mens Sheds

Followed by a mugful of strawberry cheesecake, banana, and creme fraiche at about 15:30. Getting my ears syringed tomorrow. The surgery is three minutes walk away, even on my wonky donkey legs. That is a great blessing.
And I have been singing today (I'll Fly For You) and also playing my guitar (Through The Barricades). It's been a Spandau Ballet day!

item.title: 12 April 2019
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Not a bad night. Mirtazapine at 18:30, half a Z at 20:00. Awake just after 02:00, so took the second half Z. Didn't really go back fully to sleep. Awake at 05:45 with that sad, sad feeling in the pit of my stomach. Had my morning codeine, but it didn't really help. Meditated on the feeling till I got up at 07:26. May leave my morning codeine until I get up. Also, if I wake at 02:00, take a couple of Solpadeine Max rather than Zopiclone.
Now, just before 10:00, I feel droopy, lowish mood, hot and tired, intermittent anxiety.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Had a call from Bradford Community Health Team just before 16:00 about an appointment at Shipley Hospital in a couple of weeks. A little bit anxious about this, but I think it will do me good. I was a bit evasive and defensive with the counsellor on the phone, but she's probably used to that. I'm someone with fairly serious health problems, so I can't always be an angel. I get touchy about being asked if I have thoughts of harming myself, but the GP at Abingdon Community Hospital asked me back in 2005, so it's par for the course.

I have that slight pain in my right cheekbone as well. With slight pain in my right temple as well. I wonder if this is migraine pain? I have just had a Nurofen Plus (as I may be getting slight withdrawal symptoms after overdoing it for a little while now), so we shall see.
It seems to have helped. I feel hot & tired after a trip out to Boots to pick up a scrip, round to Westgate to post a forwarded letter, then on to the corner shop for some food goodies and a chat to Suni. He has those ready-made poppadoms and tortilla wraps, so I have just heated two wraps and yesterday's biryani and am eating it with some relish. Which is a surprise, as I have no appetite. I've also got the makings for a potato curry, which I also like, and have bought some battered fish fillets. Started with four poppadoms and finished with a bowl of grapes, banana, and creme fraiche.
Just had my left ear syringed. There wasn't an awful lot left after using the Boots remover and my hearing was pretty clear. It's completely clear now, but the practice nurse says that my right ear will need doing before long. But to leave it till after Easter.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Slept fine last night without earplugs. Usual 7.5 mg Zopiclone, but didn't take my morning 30 mg codeine when I woke up. Just felt fine without it so had a lie-in until 08:00, when I got up. Been feeling a bit tired today, but it was a busy day yesterday. Shopping trip to Baildon Co-Op for my daily exercise.
My sore left ankle seems a little improved today.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Same as yesterday pretty much.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Saw Dr Kennedy yesterday and as we were discussing tapering off Zopiclone, I mentioned that I like to keep some in hand. She told me to call the surgery two days before running out of Zopiclone and she would then call me back to arrange to issue a new Zopiclone scrip to Boots. On Monday, Tuesday or Thursday. Before 14:30. Oh dear. This has me feeling anxious, so I've booked an appointment with her to renew my Mirtazapine & Zopiclone together, three days before I run out. If I'm tapering off, I may well end up with some in hand anyway. Feeling very tired today, bit of a low mood, don't feel like going out.
I guess she's worried about me stashing and it's old behaviour for me.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Text messaging from the surgery isn't working, which I advised Dr Kennedy about. Trudy from the surgery rang me yesterday saying she thinks she's fixed it. It's not been fixed. She was going to try making an appointment for me and then cancelling it to test her fix. No messages. I can't change my email address or any other contact details or preferences on their website.
UPDATE The changes I made are now live. I've changed my email address to my usual one and set my preferred contact method to email.
Finished potting up my marguerites, watered them in, and have finished cleaning up the coffee table and washing my bed-sheet. Am now having an optical migraine.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Usual night-time procedure, but woke at 04:00. Didn't seem much point in taking extra Zopiclone that late, so I went back to sleep till 06:00. Up at 07:30, but feeling knackered & anxious, no appetite, too unwell to go out safely. Going through Zopiclone withdrawal, maybe? Maybe start taking 7.5 mg every night, not taking a split dose. Dr Kennedy can decide on a safe withdrawal regime. I'm still adjusting to 30 mg Mirtazapine. I'm going to try taking the half dose that I missed now (10:30) and see if my symptoms improve. But no going out today, I think is probably the safe option.
Spoke to both Doris and Suni yesterday. Doris is poorly and Suni has pain in his "mashed" knee.
In the last three weeks, I've had pretty much 7.5 mg Zopiclone every night (one night 3.75 mg, one night off).

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Felt fine yesterday, if a bit weak in my legs with right knee pain, and tired by 19:00 (which is understandable). Took my whole 7.5 mg Zopiclone at 20:00 as usual, but took ages to get to sleep. Awake at 05:00 today, took my morning codeine (and a Nurofen Plus, for some reason) and spent a very pleasant three hours drowsing & meditating from 06:00.
Then started to droop during the day, feeling weak & weepy. Getting stressed about this messaging business with Baildon GP practice, but then I chose to chase it up. And thinking about dates, it's about 10 days since I changed my Mirtazapine dose. Hmm...

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I suspect that the reason I get so stressed about this messaging business is a combination of utter muddle and ignorance combined with a potentially angry woman like my dear departed mother.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: An awful evening yesterday. Anxiety levels ramped up so much by the end of the day that when I went to bed I was for a while in the midst of a full-blown panic attack. Had to take 300 mg ranitidine to calm my stomach acid, my ankle was really hurting, and I couldn't calm my mind. Then I got that message again, the one about having to do myself in if this continues, the same words as last time even. NO! This will pass, I thought, this is the Mirtazapine, took my Zopiclone early (about 19:20) and started to breathe long, slow, and deep, just using the Knowledge Meditation. My system calmed and I went to sleep. Awake at 01:30, though, and feeling wakeful. Took two Nurofen Plus, and managed to doze until 05:30, when I took my morning codeine. The anxiety is fading this morning.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Dozed off last night before 08:00 (which I haven't done for a good while), then took my 7.5 mg Zopiclone and slept through till 04:45, which is a decent night's rest.
