Finally woke at 06:00 with that sad heavy feeling, though, and I'm still feeling it with some anxiety added for good measure. Managed to get some of the earwax drops on my t-shirt. Also noticed a random event in my Thunderbird calendar. The sun has gone away and I feel dull, no appetite or interest, just anxious. The messaging business remains unresolved. Despite registering my old phone number, I'm not getting any text messages, although I've made and cancelled a couple of appointments since. I called in the surgery on the way to the Co-Op and on the way back, but Trudy was on the phone both times. Busy catching up after the long weekend, I guess. I've updated my phone number on their website to my new one, so she can call me on that I guess. It remains unresolved, though, which makes me anxious. Is it really worth worrying about, though? It's probably of more benefit to them than me, in terms of missed appointments.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It's only been about 14 days since I was bouncing my Mirtazapine dose up and down, so I may still be adjusting.

I managed to calm the anxiety somewhat with some slow, deep breathing. Something to remember. I'm now sweating rather a lot, although it's only 17 C today. Yet another side-effect of the Mirtazapine, no doubt. Oddly, I have a feeling of stillness & peace in the pit of my stomach amidst all the pain & anxiety. It gets rather drowned out, though.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Felt quite good by the end of the day yesterday, eating well and playing my guitar. Went to sleep as normal, but woke at 03:44 and didn't really go back to sleep properly, despite taking two strong co-codamol. Feeling knackered and glum now at 10:30. Quite weary. Still feeling lurches of anxiety now and then.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Dropped some stuff off at the charity shop and bought some eggs at the butchers. We had a brief chat after he told me that I was his first customer (at 09:30). School holidays, apparently. Sitting on the sofa, I thought about Rosie ringing me about my curtain that she is shortening. Which she did at 11:15. So I walked down to her shop through the back footpath, collected my finished curtain, and had another chat. Two apples today, no appetite, feeling cold one minute and then hot after moving about. This is all side effects and my immune system is in a bit of a state. It will pass eventually. Still putting my ear-drops in my right ear, though, preparing for having it syringed tomorrow. I will act as though this anxiety and loss of affect are temporary and will only cancel the appointment if I absolutely can't make it up the hill.

There was a repeated knock on my door and window at about 12:30. An old woman was standing there and she pointed out that I'd left my key in the outside lock. Thank you, I said. She then started to tell me about a forget-me-not in one of the beds down the hill that she'd watered and thought it belonged to me. Er, no. I gradually realised that she wasn't really all there and left her to knock on other doors. Grateful to her for the pointer about my key, though.

Checked my old Nokia mobile and there was another NHS registration link. Forwarded it on to my iPhone and it won't accept my credentials (DOB and mobile number) at all. Says they're incorrect. The Nokia is now switched off and in a box and it will stay like that until I feel better. If Trudy rings, I'll ask her to forget about this whole business as I'm unwell with an anxiety-based illness and it's not helping. It's just broken in some way that I can only guess at. Like so much software done on the cheap by outsourcers, fine when it works but worse than useless when there's a problem.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Another rough night. Only had a couple of apples yesterday, so no huge surprise. Took 7.5 mg Zopiclone at 20:00 after some lying down meditation (on my back rather than my side) for a couple of hours. Awake at 01:22. Took four strong co-codamol between then and when I got up at 09:00, including my morning codeine. Stressing over this SMS business again.
Then a surprise hand-delivered letter from Landlady Liz asking to do a brief inspection. I called her, no reply, then spotted her in the yard and she came in and did the inspection there and then. Three-monthly inspections are now a requirement of her lettings insurance agency after she found a cannabis farm in one of her houses in Baildon. She had no complaints, said it all looked neat & fine. I mentioned that the carpets could do with cleaning, wobbly legs making it difficult, and she didn't seem that bothered.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep and started dreaming before taking my Zopiclone last night. Woke up feeling rested and had a good couple of hours lying meditation before getting up at about 07:30. Contemplated a couple of upcoming appointments and didn't feel that usual lurch of sickness & worry. Also managed to increase my monthly Bulb payment (and ignore their suggestion for the time being) without getting stressed. Did some quick sums and even their suggested payment of £109 per month can be accommodated. Went out for my walk round the block after showering and cleaning up, but now I feel very sleepy tired and it's raining, so not going out shopping to Sunny's and Shipley as planned. Feeling that solid restful feeling in the pit of my stomach and also feeling rather cold, none of that overheated anxiety feeling. Got some food cooking for lunch and have just been meditating. Turned the heating up and put the space heater on. Having a little difficulty focussing my eyes and feel slightly dizzy occasionally.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Got the munchies. Eaten a spag bol, two apples, and three Tunnocks Tea Cakes. Still hungry but don't want to get an upset stomach. It's usually a good sign, though.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling much more energetic & hungry today. Didn't start feeling hot & tired until about 14:00, and even then it was bearable. Had my phone assessment with the MyWellbeing College clinician Catherine, which went very well. The phone line was a bit crackly both ways, but it was very pleasant, not stressful at all.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep and started dreaming again before taking my Zopiclone last night. Had a good night's rest. Woke before dawn, but went back to sleep. Feeling grotty this morning, though. No appetite, interest, or energy. Have drunk two cups of coffee and eaten two apples & three Tunnocks Tea Cakes. Went shopping to the Co-Op in sunshine and freezing cold wind. I shall have to postpone my shopping and reconnaissance trip to Shipley. Have dug out my coat, hat, gloves and scarf in readiness for Sarah & Jamie's visit tomorrow morning. The inner critic is loud in my head today, focussing on people offering me unrequested offers of helpful advice.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Still exhausted today after yesterday's visit from Sarah & Jamie. The questionnaires I completed for MyWellbeing College tell me (from the scores) that I'm moderately severely depressed. So completing three hours with a lively, sometimes fractious, little boy of "nearly eight" is probably an achievement.
Oh and I mended this Wordpress installation after a couple of hours on the net looking for the solution to a mysterious database error.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I could ask Ju about coping with energetic small boys, sometimes a bit naughty or fractious (jumping on the sofa, sitting at the PC when he's just been told by Sarah that he's not going on it, slapping me with his cap (and getting a slap back and a telling off)). But in many ways, he's just the grandson I would have asked for. He's certainly very bright. In the car, I heard him start a completely coherent sentence with "basically". He has really good handwriting as well.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Low today, no energy, no appetite. Got an optician's appointment at 14:15 and I've been stressing about that all day, along with the problem of where to buy milk. Avoiding Suni again. The weather is pretty grim as well.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Managed to get to my eye test. Only five minutes walk, so another blessing having the opticians so close. Optometrist recommends using eye drops for dry eyes (as I'm doing) but for long-term use get drops without preservative (as that can be an irritant). I have slight discolouration on my corneas indicating growth of cataracts, but it's very slow (and easily fixed by operation, she said). She recommended another eye test in two years. Which is the length of time since my last one (at Robert Stanley in Abingdon), judging by the reminder they emailed me earlier this year (12 April). So I haven't actually left it for ages. after all. And she said that I have "very good vision". So no worries.

I also have a minor eyelid condition with the delightful name of blepharitis that can contribute to eye redness and irritation (dry eye syndrome). They sold me a box of special lid wipes -- 10 days supply for £9.99. I'll have to find a cheaper source than that! Optometrist also measured a putative prescription for my computer glasses and can take them in to be checked. Hmm... I gave her the wrong distance (out by about six inches) and my existing glasses work fine for computer work, no eye strain, bright and clear at just over an arm's length.

One of the opticians said use lid wipes once a day, before going to bed. You can also make your own cleaning solution (details in the patient leaflet Blepharitis-leaflet.pdf) or buy a bottle of it and apply it with cotton-wool buds. LidCare (CIBAVision) Blephaclean (Spectrum Thea) Supranettes (Alcon)

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Feeling a bit more human, but still tired and weak in both mind and body. Probably the best way to put it is that I feel vulnerable.

Fell asleep before taking my Zopiclone again last night. It's raining, grey and cloudy, and I've got the heating turned up to 9. May turn it down to 8 later on as I've also got the wood-stove lit and burning smokeless fuel. In May!

Had some biscuits and an apple to eat yesterday. Today I have so far had two apples and a Waitrose beef casserole with dumplings. Not planning on going out on this soaking wet day. Curious to see if food affects my mood more or less than fresh air. Both are good, ideally, along with human contact.

Had a Badedas bath, then a pot of tea and another apple. May have some bombay mix later whilst reading on my iPad. I use a teaspoon, if you're wondering about greasy fingers :-)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Had a good night's rest (nine hours or so 21:00-06:00), felt fine on waking up & meditating, but droopy and anxious at midday. Went out for some milk and biscuits in the very cold rain. Not really very pleasurable or an incentive to go out walking for relaxation. Tucked up cosy in my little house with the wood-stove lit.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Seeing Dr Higgins tomorrow for my two-weekly checkup. There has been a slight improvement, my manic/panic levels are down, and I have felt pleasantly rested and calm on a couple of occasions whilst meditating. They weren't long periods, but feeling rested (even if only occasionally) is enough of an improvement, to be honest. I haven't felt that way for a while now.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I discovered today that the heavy negative state I sometimes get into can be calmed or lifted by doing the long slow deep breathing that I've been using for panic. The early-mid afternoon seems to be a bad time for those states.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had a hard time getting up even at 09:00 this morning, although I felt as right as rain yesterday evening. Dr Higgins told us today that this is a sign of recovery, that the meds are working. Well, I never. He increased my dose to 50 mg today. Fingers crossed.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke up at 06:30 this morning after a very restful sleep. Curiously, in the same posture that I went to sleep. Up at 08:30 without checking the clock. Felt quite bright & up this morning, although at 12:00 I'm beginning to feel the pull of tiredness & anxiety. Didn't finish my six sausages and chips for lunch, either. Don't want to get heartburn.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Didn't get any heartburn and I've got the munchies. Currently scoffing the last of a bag of bombay mix. Had some quiet time meditating, feeling my body temperature go slowly up and down. Curious. It struck me that meditating may largely be about not making a fuss. Bodhipakśa says something like this in one of his guided meditations. Came across two people today with chronic foot pain: Mr Cullingford the Baildon butcher has arthritis in one of his feet and Chris Bent has gout.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell half-asleep before taking my Zopiclone, woke up, took half, then fell asleep again, woke up, took the other half. Awake at 03:15, got up, took two strong co-codamol. Awake again at 05:55, took my morning codeine, then had a 3.5 hour shamatha. And a very restful and pleasant one too. Good for a Sunday morning, no appointments or other commitments. Don't think it was all that codeine. I've had those amounts before and never had a shamatha. I usually wake up feeling sad and empty. We shall see. It was a blessed relief.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept through till just after 6 again and forgot to take my morning codeine.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Out for a walk to Baildon Bank in the late morning, on the way dropped a bag of items off at Age UK and bought some shorts. Had bacon-cheesey-potatoes for lunch. Out at 14:15 to Shipley, did the walk from the town square to the hospital, spotted the Hive on the way, bought another pair of shorts on the way back. Back to Baildon, bought Dr Peppers and poppadoms and had a chat to Suni. Phew!
Oh and I got a call from MyWellbeing College this morning. In the middle of having a pee. They have offered me a place on a course starting 28th July and will confirm by letter two weeks before it starts.

item.title: Eye eye
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Onward selling following an eye test. Optometrist tells me that I have dry eyes, but to be careful of eye drops containing preservative, as they can cause additional irritation. Bought a bottle of HycoSan Original and, after deciphering the rather complicated instructions, used them for five days with absolutely no discernible effect. Cost £10. She also diagnosed blepharitis and the opticians (Vision Express) kindly sold me a box of lid wipes. Cost £10. For 20 wipes and you need to use two a day. You can make the solution up yourself with bicarbonate of soda and buy a box of cotton buds to apply it with.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
May be becoming vegetarian? Channa dal made from an Aldi kit for lunch (very tasty) with tortillas, apple, three dark chocolate Tunnocks Tea Cakes. Bombay mix and another apple in the late afternoon.
My meditations are becoming very satisfying & productive. Still get the occasional <gulp> of anxiety but overall far less stressed than of late.
Didn't take my afternoon 30 mg of codeine phosphate. Want to come off it now that I'm feeling better. After a week of just taking my morning 30 mg, I'll drop that to 15 mg, then stop.
Just put the heating back on as tomorrow will be the last of the bright, warm sunny days we've been having. Down to 16 degrees from 18 today. The sun will come back, I'm sure.
Just put my shortened curtain up!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
"becoming vegetarian" What about the scotch egg? Oops!
At about 19:30, I started getting leg jerks in bed, so got up and took my afternoon 30 mg of codeine. Coming off that can wait until I'm off the Zopiclone, at least, and a bit steadier in recovery from my anxiety.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Shaking, dry mouth, anxious after a phone call to the Hive to cancel my booking of the Creative Hand Loom Weaving course. There's only one bus service from Baildon on Sundays and it starts at 09:45, getting me to the Hive at around 10:15. The course starts at 10:00. It was a patchy call, my phone signal kept breaking up, and I was talking to a young man who kept calling me "mate" and was writing my bank details down to pass to somebody coming in on Monday. He first wanted me to email my bank details, I said that wasn't very secure, he said loads of people do it, and it kind of went downhill from there. Although it ended fine, it felt like confrontation. Things to learn, maybe: The Hive is, I guess, run by volunteers on a shoestring. So some things can be done automatically (like the booking) and others need to be done manually (like the refund). I chose to refuse the suggestion to email my bank details. Which is fair enough, isn't it? But it started a disagreement. Next time, use email. I phoned as I thought I would have to supply a reason for cancelling. That wasn't the case, and when I started to explain he said "it doesn't matter". If email doesn't work, use the phone. Email is as convenient for them as it is for me. Provided they don't ignore it, which makes me anxious. And wait before committing. I was going to check the bus timetables, did a two-hour meditation, and forgot about it. Went ahead and booked as a form of action showing how well I'm doing.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: * It was only £10. It could have been £90. * He won't even remember the call. People who answer the phone for a living must get used to tricky calls. * It was no worse than other calls like that that I've had when feeling well.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling the anxiety. Awake at 04:15, got up and took a Nurofen Plus, then woke again at 05:50. The time went very quickly, I must say. A bit blue today, though.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Walked to my sweet seat spot to soothe my soul. It must have rained in the night, because the air smelt damp and fresh. Wandering around Mount Pleasant, tap tapping with my walking stick like Blind Pew.
Oh and the young man in the Post Office called me "mate" after I made a comment about paying more cash than I'd requested. Just being friendly, like women calling you "love".

And after a couple of visits to the corner shop (to check whether they stock pastry cases -- they don't and to buy some tortillas) and to Bagpuss (the second-hand shop -- to examine a linen basket -- it was too small) and with chats with the women running the shops (Rani and ?), I now have an appetite for quiche and chips. Coming up, sir!

When I came back from staying with Sarah, the house looked very bright. I expected it to look dark & forbidding, as that was my mood. I want this house to be a safe, protected & comfortable place of refuge, not a prison. Ditto for Baildon. I also had a chat with her (is it Dot or Lyn?) in the Age UK shop after dropping another bagful of stuff off to check the weather. With the wind, it's cool enough for trousers today.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 04:15, went back to sleep, then woke again at 05:50. Feeling strangely blue today, just a bit sad and empty. Am I feeling lonely?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Out to the Co-Op despite my desire to stop spending so much whenever I go out. Ingredients for a custard tart. It's a bit overcast, but a lovely spring day with the birds & flowers all out, and a very slight breeze. Warm enough for shorts.
Feeling the hot flush of anxiety. Watchful and fearful. No appetite, restless.
Still got that troublesome dry scaly skin on my right hand. Put some Betnovate on it to soak in during my 1.5 hour meditation and it seems to have quite improved it.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Last night, for the second time in a week, I woke at around midnight after having fallen asleep (I guess at around 21:00 or so) without taking my Zopiclone 7.5 tablet. Couldn't fall asleep again without taking it eventually, but it must be a good sign of my recovery. Shaky & anxious today, though. An overcast morning, which I spent some of lying on my bed. Had a nice long chat on the phone with Sarah, though, who messaged me later on FB to tell me that I'm "doing great". It doesn't feel like it at times. I feel fearful about everything today, although I have done the washing up, watered my plants, and had a normal day's food.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Took my Zopiclone earlier than usual (at 20:00?) and woke at 06:45. Had quite a busy afternoon yesterday with Sarah, climbing down Baildon Bank, eating a "mini meal" of fish and chips (which was a full meal-size portion), followed by a trip to the recycling bank, then shopping in the wind & rain at B&M. So lots of exercise. Meditated till 09:00 this morning, but feeling a little tired/flat now. Have eaten normally, though, so the feeling will evaporate as the day goes on, as it has been doing recently. Potting up a fuchsia and an osteo into one of those chimney-pots for outside. Weighted the bottom down with stones from the yard. Should improve the drainage, stop it from blowing over, and stop anyone nicking it.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Normal stuff this morning. Awake at 05:15, drowsed until 06:00 (when the heating come on), took my morning codeine, meditated until 09:00. Have showered, cleaned my teeth, dressed, made the bed, and checked my plants. And now I just feel sad & empty & blue, no appetite, no interest, fearful of coming events like the library job and the dentist. Oh and seeing the doctor tomorrow. Worried a bit about having £1500 in outstanding debt and then realised that I have a fairly hefty collection of magazines to sell.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
The temperature has just shot up from 14°C to 19°C and now the house feels hot instead of cold. I wonder if that was what made me finally get up after 1.5 days lying in/on my bed.
Last night, took Zopiclone 7.5 early (at about 19:00). Awake just after midnight, took two Solpadeine Max, still awake at some point, went downstairs and took half a Zimovane. Awake again at 03:15, downstairs again for a Nurofen Plus. Awake at usual time, lay in bed meditating on my back until just before 12:00. That was the point at which my ankle started hurting. Back to bed, same as before, then just decided to get up at about 13:30.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I had the insight today that, despite a couple of days feeling ropey & tired, I am in fact slowly getting better.
Okay Saturday & Sunday, started to droop on the Bank Holiday Monday PM, started feeling better Thursday PM. so four days low.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: It was dark when I took my Zopiclone last night and I woke up just after 07:00. At 10:20, I'm feeling listless.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Some physical things seem to be getting better. The dry scaly skin on my right hand has all but gone and my big toes don't feel so sore. There may also be less dry skin on my shins & knees, despite not having washed them for a couple of days.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Last night, took Zopiclone 7.5 early (at about 19:00). Awake just after 01:00, went downstairs and took half a Zimovane. Awake again at 04:15, downstairs again for a Nurofen Plus. Awake at usual time, lay in bed meditating until just before 15:00. Feeling sapped & zapped on the biochemical merry-go-round. Do I need more regular exercise? I suspect that might help. I've only been out of the house once in the last six days.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Ugh. Spent Monday and Tuesday in bed, pretty much. Full of anxiety a lot of the time, ankle and knee arthritis both hurting. Got eczema on my arms & hands as well, lots of wrinkly, dry, flaky skin. Redness in the crooks of my elbows as well, although not itchy. Bit 'o Betnovate should sort that out.
Saw the dentist this morning, who has given me the all-clear for a year. Picked up my curtain from Rosie, who was 15 minutes away from calling me. She doesn't strike me as the sort of person who would just say that sort of thing (unlike Nasty Nick Sharland), so more cosmic felicity.
Plant woes. My hanging basket got quite dehydrated and has a fair number of dead flowers as a result. The marguerite is also covered in dead flowers, although it still looks healthy. And the indoor ivy has spider mites, which explains the discoloured/dying leaves. Planted a bug-killer spike in the pot and cut off all the infested foliage. It's looking a bit bare, but should (fingers crossed) survive.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Spent some time yesterday afternoon lying on my bed. The time seemed to pass slowly. Did two suppositories and finally managed a movement after being codeine-blocked for a couple of days. Quite sore afterwards, but no bleeding and bot feels fine today. Found one of the suppositories on the bedroom rug after jumping up to go. Oh well.
Was writing emails and got up for a peanut butter sandwich at 20:30 last night. After taking my Zopiclone! Slept through till 04:00, took one Nurofen Plus, then took my morning codeine at 05:00. Up at 07:00, showered, had tea, and went out for a short walk this morning. I've got the washing on and now feel utterly knackered at 09:45. Low, anxious, no appetite or energy. Debating whether to cook a custard tart. I may leave it till later.
Ate a normal day's food.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It's an uncomfortable thought that I am using sleep to fill the empty space in my life, and using Zopiclone and codeine to achieve that.

Hmm, that's a pretty negative point of view. Like my succulent cuttings, which lay on the soil for up to two weeks before sprouting roots. And rememembering how I shared about emptiness at that Blackpool meeting shortly after entering recovery.

Maybe dormant is a better word. At the moment, I'm trashing lots of stuff on my computer and on the net. If this is a new start, let it be so. Well, almost :-) I'm nearly ready for a step three. There are still some "buts" for me yet. But I'm beginning to feel thoroughly fed up with being miserable all the time.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Ate snackage yesterday: two apples, some bombay mix, three Tunnocks, and then at about 19:00 a cheese and onion sandwich. The last item is not really recommended at bedtime.
I fell asleep on it, though, and woke at 22:30. Took my Z and woke again at 05:00. Took my morning codeine and drowsed/meditated until just after 07:30, when I got up. Feeling well compared to yesterday and now eating hot food at 11:45 (bacon-cheesy potatoes). This morning I have collected my prescription from Boots, had my hair cut by my barber Tony (real name Antonio), and shopped at the Co-Op for some flowers and apples. The flower bag leaked and I left my walking stick in the shop, but didn't get stressed about either. Oh and I've just done a clothes wash and dry.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Ate a normal day's food yesterday. Felt a bit low in the afternoon, but didn't lie on my bed and went to bed at 18:15. Had a good night's sleep, Zopiclone at about 21:00 and awake at just after 05:00. Up at 07:30, but felt low and continue feeling cold & low. It's a godawful wet, grey, cold & dreary 12 degrees today and I've lit the stove, turned the heating up to 7, and got the space heater turned on in the big bedroom. Lying on my bed and waiting for the sun. I'd forgotten about this dreary West Yorkshire weather. I can remember comparing it to the Riviera sun to that counsellor Sarah when I lived in Leeds. At the moment, I feel cold inside and out.
Showered and watered the plants this morning. Have been doing the physio exercises for the past couple of days. One small blessing on this wretched day is that my ankle is not quite so stabbingly sore. I also have an appetite of sorts. Well, I can feel and hear my stomach gurgling (so I'm hungry), but I'm not tempted by any of the goodies in my fridge.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It gets worse :-( Down to 10 degrees tomorrow. And cloudy. All day. "Flaming June?"

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
To bed at 18:15 yesterday, took my 30 mg mirtazapine & 50 mg pregabalin. Fell asleep on it and woke at 22:05. Took my 7.5 mg Zopiclone and woke again at 05:00. Took my morning codeine and drowsed/meditated until just after 07:30, when I got up.
Have been doing the Jon Kabat-Zinn Body Scan guided meditation the past couple of days, even with a sore ankle, so today I took my afternoon codeine at 13:00, lay on my bed, played the Body Scan on my iPad, and then lay meditating on my ankle. Surprisingly effective, and when I got up it was 14:30. Feeling quite relatively happy & active this afternoon, although I am still vulnerable to those heart-clutching moments of fear. The thought of cancelling my annual Ocado subscription was one that occurred during that afternoon meditation. Accept it, let it go. It will be all right. It's situations involving money and/or confrontation that seem the worst for these little panic attacks.
That time of day (13:00-14:00) is when I feel my depression the worst. Maybe because that's when my ankle really starts to hurt. Walked around Baildon today, which seemed to make it worse after two days lying in/on my bed. But the X-ray at Shipley Hospital shows the joint as normal.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Feeling rough today. Tired, anxious, hot & cold, can't concentrate, no interest in anything. This will pass. I have showered and am eating and haven't taken any extra codeine for a while, though.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Split my Z pill last night. First half at 20:20. which took me through till 01:30. The second half took me through till 05:30, when I took my morning codeine. I was naughty and took two Nurofen Plus about an hour later as I had stomach ache. Up at about 09:00, though.
It struck me this morning that I moved to France to escape the grotty Leeds weather, cried when I returned in an icy January, and am now living in West Yorkshire again. Is this one of those "try it and see" gestures from the universe, like finding a job in Brum? Mind you, it's like this across the whole North, so very much the same in Lancaster. Oh well.
I do wonder if my depression is lifting today, even if only a little.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The eczema on my arms is much better.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
To bed at 18:15, took my Zopiclone at 21:20, awake at 05:15, up at 07:15. Have showered, had a coffee, watered the plants, and popped out to the shops. Now feel quite grim, anxious, no energy or appetite, and my ankle and knee both hurt. The weather is picking up, though: it's 16 degrees today, warm enough for shorts. Some rain is promised, but there should be some good spells of sunshine in between. Ho hum. Do I always feel like this after spending a good period of time with people?
Find myself having a running conversation in my head with Suni about that blasted Indian ginseng. He's now selling it in the shop and has recommended it to me again. I did that people-pleasing thing of saying I would look into its benefits when the truth is that I not only suspect that it may have limited or no benefit and, if it does, I don't want to be taking it alongside my other head meds. Frightened of upsetting other people and provoking confrontations and anger. The truth is that he probably isn't that bothered. I'm not being sufficiently assertive, and that causes me anxiety and feeds the eternal internal critic.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Actually, it may fall into the same category as St John's wort. The clinical evidence for that working as an anti-depressant is not conclusive, but there are warnings about taking it alongside SSRIs such as fluoxetine. So, it's an interesting substance, and may work for some people, but it's not for me. And try to remember to be gentle, both with him and with Little Phil :-)

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: The eczema on my arms is pretty much all gone and on my legs is much reduced. Still got some on my abdomen, though. Just been out for a 30-minute walk without using my stick once. Second walk of the day, as I had a 15-minute walk around the block this morning. Time now for a cup of tea and some plain chocolate Tunnocks. And maybe a strum on my trusty old banjo :-)

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: After all that exercise, my legs feel a bit weak today. Slept through on half a Z last night, though, which is encouraging. Feel a bit flat today, though quite peaceful with it. Have had a couple of sessions of sitting meditation this morning and a walk around the block.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had another half a Z last night, but woke at about 03:15 and didn't really go back to sleep. Been lying on my bed today, interspersed with bouts of manic activity watering and repotting plants and making a bacon & cheese omelette to empty the fridge of fresh produce nearing its best-by date.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had another half a Z last night, woke at about 00:30 and thankfully went back to sleep. Been lying on my bed today, meditating. Up at about 13:30.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Had another half a Z last night, but woke at about 03:15. Took my morning codeine and managed to doze until just after 05:00, which is a normal waking up time for me given the time I go to bed and to sleep. Lying in bed until 12:00, then shorts on and lying on the bed until 14:30 or so. Eating cheese on toast, the last remnants of a nearly-empty fridge that now contains half a mouldering loaf and a potato. The last Tunnocks will be scoffed shortly.
The eczema on my lower arms, abdomen, and lower legs has gone. The surgery scar still aches at the T6 point (which is where I guess the plastic clip is located).

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Slept through till 04:44 on half a Z last night. Up at 10:00 after doing the Body Scan meditation. Out to the Co-op for some shopping, my first walk in four days. Oh dear.
Remembering this morning how I pushed quite a few people away in my early recovery. Chrissie Gladwin, Keith, Kevin, and (most shamefully) Jerry.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Took me ages to get to sleep last night, but I eventually slept through till 04:14. Took my morning codeine and had a very peaceful shamatha until about 07:30. Washed, dressed, teeth clean, bathroom cleaned, out for a walk, and now I feel flat. Not really inspired, although not suffering from that heart-clutching adrenaline rush anxiety that has dogged me for so long.
The last time I felt so peaceful was 12 May. That was a Sunday morning too. Six weeks ago to the day. And just over six weeks since I started on 50 mg Pregabalin.

item.dc:creator: phil

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Done my usual stuff but feeling a bit flat and uninspired now. Maybe things will improve as the day goes on. Spent a while doing cash forecasts and I can live with a rent increase to £700 and paying Bulb £200 to clear the large deficit I've got (since I get my winter fuel payment of £200 in November).
Bought a chicken curry at Westgate Stores and had a nice chat with Suni, who told me about activities at Baildon Community Link.

My blepharitis has improved considerably after about a week of using the cotton buds and boiled water with bicarb, sometimes twice a day. My eyes were even clear enough this morning to probably do without the eye drops. They make my eyes look less red, but they dry to an unpleasant crust around my eyes.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Drowsed off yesterday evening till it was dark, took my half a Zopiclone, then slept through till 04:30. Took my morning codeine and meditated until 07:25.
Having done all the chores and repotted several plants, I want to go for a quiet lie down. But the builders are angle grinding. It's 10:30 and it's 12 degrees, grey, and my marguerite seems to be dying. Spent ages yesterday agonising about putting the bin out and the fact that Maria the Boots pharmacist spent about 20 minutes splitting 28 Zopiclone tablets in half with her fingernails. Why? I can split them myself. But the scrip was for half. The truth is, I'm going to end up with plenty of Zopiclone in reserve and it doesn't matter if they're split or not.
The bin gets collected with the church bins just before 08:00, for future reference.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: My marguerite has apparently been overwatered. Need to reduce to once a week from twice. On Wednesdays, as I watered it today. Have been lying on my bed most of the day, listening to continual angle grinding noise and worrying about money. No food, just sips of water and a cup of Assam tea.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Drowsed off yesterday evening till it was dark, took my half a Zopiclone, then woke at 01:06, and again at 04:16. At that point, I still felt quite wakeful, even after taking my morning codeine, so I took one of the halves in the Boots bottle and slept till 07:00. Was still lying on my side in bed at 09:06, when the phone rang with a message from Jane to say that the start of the Living Life group therapy course had been put back to 25th July. She apologised for waking me up, as I said I was having a lie in. I got up at about 10:00. Have chatted to three people this morning: the foreman from the building site, who is apparently staying in Shipley for the duration as it's a 1.5 hour drive from Rochdale; a woman buying a ready meal in he Co-op; and then chatting to my next-door neighbour Doris about finding somewhere nice to sit outside when the weather is good.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Out pensioner shopping today in charity and knockoff shops in Shipley and Baildon and got a pack of three sport socks, a polo shirt, and a feather cushion for £6 total.
I had the strangest experience this morning. Woke at 04:06, turned over, turned back to check the time, and it was 05:06. Had codeine and a meditation as usual and got up at 07:00.
I don't think my marguerite is dying from being overwatered. It's got plenty of new growth and drains properly, so I think the yellowing and woody bits are just old foliage. I shall go back to bi-weekly watering.
Oh and I went to bed at 19:15 last night after a backgammon session on my iPhone. The latest for ages.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
I don't know what it is about Adam, but he does provoke my anger. The latest episode was a fairly sour-spirited trollish reply of his to a Facebook post of mine about enjoying the belated appearance of the sun here in Baildon. There are times when he can be thoughtful, generous & kind, but they always seem to be outweighed in my mind by the arrogant, mouthy teenager who refused to walk alongside me in Leeds, but was happy for me to buy breakfast for him. And the rest. Resentments all well nursed.
Anyway, slept well last night, dozed off and then slept through till just after 05:00. Up at 07:00. Climbed Baildon Hill today, up as far as the bench.
Feeling full of shame today. Embarrassed by the smallest things, like sniffing on one of the videos I took on top of Baildon Hill. Anxious, watchful, jumpy, quick to anger & criticise, unable to judge appropriate behaviour. And low mood to cap it all, possibly as a result of all that negative thinking. And looking for constant reassurance from Facebook.
Odd weather. The BBC website shows the temperature as currently 26 degrees, but in the house it feels cold enough to have the heating back on. I switched it off last night in anticipation of the mini heatwave predicted for today. Ah, and left the front window in the big bedroom open a little. A cool breeze and warm sunshine. It's good, though, because heating the house up is certainly easier than cooling it down. Like people.
Postscript: The house gets warmer as the sun shines on the windows at the back. So from about 13:00 onwards? Depends on the time of year, I suppose.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I am now out front with my shirt off and a cup of tea, pruning the dead growth from my marguerite (argyranthemum frutescens). Nice to feel the sun on my back, although my lower back aches a little from some unaccustomed bending and stretching.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Tried a night off the Zopiclone, but I was still half-asleep (though dreaming) at 01:15, so took a half. Maybe this is the way to do it, rather than alternating nights? Anyway, awake at 04:46 for codeine and meditation. Feeling that old uselessness and "no reason to get up" but I did anyway at 07:30 or so. It's a funny day for weather, the BBC weather site says it's overcast and 20 degrees, but it's quite bright and sunny a lot of the time and it's warm enough for me to have my shirt off. Have been cleaning the front step and doormat and sweeping the porch and stairs with a dustpan and brush.
Turned the heating on and off twice today!
Had a lovely peaceful restful hour-long shamatha after doing the body scan at 13:00. The pain in my ankle was turned way down low and I wasn't disturbed by any painful or fearful thoughts at at all. Just focussed on the breath, doing the Knowledge mantra. The best I've felt for what seems like ages.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Tried another night off the Zopiclone, awake at 00:03, went back to sleep until 03:16, took my codeine, still awake at 04:00, took half a Z but didn't go back to sleep. Meditated until around 07:15, when I got up.
I was having a quite unpleasant dream when I woke at 3 o'clock. Something about sitting a PhD viva connected with horses and in Dutch. I'd done something wrong, but the examiners were being unforgiving and I was close to tears.
Realised why I may be so anxious about hosting Jamie in this house. Memories of being stuck with a surly, uncommunicative Adam for several days while he either went out for walks on his own or played on my laptop all day. We did talk about me storming out when he cooked Christmas food for me in 2017, but I don't feel that I explained my feelings or that he understood. The truth is, as my wise self reminds me, that the only person who remembers that incident or is suffering from it is me. Can I change it? No, but unpleasant or shameful memories have a knack of hanging around my head. Looking forward to doing some talking therapy later on in July.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
If I wake early, I may need to just wait. Taking a half Zopiclone at 4 in the morning may not be too wise if I'm getting up around 7.
The eczema is back on my thumb edges and my legs feel stiff whilst walking, especially around my knees.

Adam's comment may not have been as sour-faced as I thought. He doesn't use smileys. It may have been a jokey comment.
And I do get the devil in me sometimes. Thinking of when I was investigating Paul Manion's website for SEO and uploaded a joke photo of the other editor. Not so professional.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Tried another night off the Zopiclone, asleep fairly rapidly, then awake at 01:40, tried going back to sleep until 02:20, when I took my codeine by mistake, then took half a Z. Not really sure if I went back to sleep. Vague memory of waking again at 05:30 and thinking "Oh only two hours till I get up". Had a lie-in till 9 o'clock.
Anxiety can make you clumsy & forgetful. I have just squashed a worker bee trying to take it out of the house and also broke one of the little apple seedlings that have grown from apple pips in the snakeskin fittonia pot. Oh well, never mind. There will be plenty of new worker bees and apple seedlings to come and I didn't do it on purpose.
Quite anxious/excited about my library induction tomorrow. Getting up this morning was a bit of a struggle. Will take a scheduled half Z tonight just to be sure of a good night's sleep.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Took my scheduled half Z just after 22:00 and woke just after 05:00. Up at 08:00.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Tried another night off the Zopiclone, asleep fairly rapidly, then awake at 00:15. Tried going back to sleep, but ended up taking a half Z after a while. Awake again at 03:15, back to sleep, awake for good just after 5. Up quite late, maybe 08:30.
Despite the jangly night's sleep, feeling fairly calm, rested, and upbeat. I suspect that the two hour library volunteer induction yesterday has something to do with that.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Decided to stop trying nights off the Zopiclone and try taking quarter Zopiclones, as I did last summer. Fell asleep at about 21:00, then woke at 02:05. Took quarter Z, then slept through until 05:00. Up at 07:45.

item.title: Clippy
item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Remember Clippy? The animated Microsoft Office assistant that would pop up with "helpful hints" when you were in the middle of using Word (in my case). I never found anybody that liked it and the feature proved to be so universally unpopular that Microsoft eventually killed it off.
It's interesting that so many modern websites attempt to "engage" with their visitors using the same approach. Overlays, chat windows, digital assistants. I do wonder whether website owners ever do any UX research. Or perhaps they are sold this guff by website designers, like the Year 2000 fixes con.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Fell asleep at about 21:00, then woke at 00:22. Took quarter Z, then slept through until 04:46. Up at 07:15.
Have had the heating off for two days with no discomfort. Outside temperature = 19 or 20 degrees. Today is forecast to be 21, but it's a cloudy morning, and I've got the heating on. I feel a bit droopy as well, but nothing too serious.
Had a walk and chat with a dog-walking chap called Geoff, who said that he's lived in Baildon for 50 years. Crikey!

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Fell asleep at about 21:00, then woke at 02:16. Took quarter Z, then slept through until 06:05. Up at 08:30. Feeling quite flat & dull. My ordinary washing & other morning activities seem arduous and I have intermittent anxiety about the usual things (J visiting, for example). Even the Ocado delivery on Tuesday. My shadowing session on Wednesday. Feel oddly calm inside and ignoring anxious impulses to check things over and over. Like whether my T-shirts are creased and if it's visible. The truth is that they have slight creasing, but it's only noticeable to me.
Funny old weather, though. Cloudy and sunny in equal measure and it feels cold when the clouds are over. Got the heating turned back on and enjoyed a cup of coffee and some Brittle Bites sitting on a cushion on the doorstep with my T-shirt off, greeting people walking to church.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep at about 21:00, then woke at 23:23. Took quarter Z, then slept through until 03:16, when I took my codeine. Awake at a time I can't remember. Up at 08:45 after a long and pleasant meditation session. I thought it was later. Been out for a walk but feel really tired now for some reason.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Fell asleep at dusk, then woke at some time after 23:00. Took quarter Z, then had a restless sleep until about 04:15, when I took my codeine. Fell asleep and woke again at about 05:15. Meditated till getting up at 08:30. Went out for a walk in the drizzle after tea and showering, cleaned the bathroom window sill, but got very tired, hot, sweating. Coming off the Zopiclone and nerves about my shadowing session tomorrow, I guess.
I've had a long lie down (from about 12 to 3) with Body Scan and feel quite rested now. If I feel rough in the morning, I'll have to reschedule then. I don't want to jump the gun and cancel today. It's only shadowing and Rachel knows about my health problems (the session was booked for 09:30 to 12 rather than 1, the closing time on a Wednesday).
The Ocado delivery was booked for 11:30-12:30 and arrived at 11:36. Excellent, as I was feeling quite knackered by then. Got all the items as well (pots & saucers plus stuff the Co-op don't sell and other stuff to make up the order to £40).
My scalp gets very crusty and I need to wash my hair more often. I was scratching my head yesterday afternoon with showers of dandruff falling on my dark T-shirt. Yuck.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep at dusk, then woke just before 01:00. Took quarter Z, then slept until about 04:15. Bit confused about what happened after that (I lost an hour somewhere), but I took my codeine at 06:05. Up at 8 as planned for my shadowing session. Two more nights on the Zopiclone, then stop hopefully.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep at dusk, then had a restless sleep (tummy-ache from the hot peppers in the Dirty Fries?) and woke at precisely 00:00. Took quarter Z, then slept until 05:15. I took my codeine at 06:05 and took the remaining quarter Z with it by mistake. Up at 09:30 after meditating on that sad, empty feeling.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Had a Nurofen Plus before my shadowing session yesterday. Not good :-( Just made my mouth dry and I was hoarse throughout. Oddly, I spoke at length to one of the Co-op employees with a normal voice, no hoarseness or coughing. Might be worth getting checked over by a GP, as I have difficulty swallowing pills in bed sometimes.
Haven't had any ranitidine at all for ages. Still got slight eczema on my lower legs and right thumb edge.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
No Zopiclone last night. Fell asleep before dusk, woke at some point (but didn't check the clock), then awake at 05:45. Took codeine, then meditated till 07:15. It seemed like a lot longer and the house was wonderfully warm & quiet when I got up. The sun was shining on my morning walk as well.
A good shamatha seems to last either 45 minutes or 1.5 hours (as this morning).

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Had strong coffee, cream meringue, two corn on the cobs, and spag bol today.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: No Zopiclone again last night. Fell asleep before dusk, woke at 04:45 after a restless couple of hours, then awake fully at 05:54. Took codeine, then meditated till 07:30. It was a good shamatha, very restful, using the Knowledge Meditation mantra, no fearful or intrusive thoughts arising till the end.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Feeling a bit down & weepy today. The result of a restless night?

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Pema Chödrön writes in When Things Fall Apart about a spiritually inspiring time when she did nothing but read, hike, sleep, cook, eat, meditate, and write. Hmm... that's pretty much how I spend my days.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep before dusk, woke at 01:30, took a quarter Z, then awake fully at 05:45. Took codeine, then meditated till 09:00. Another really good restful shamatha.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I can feel anxiety rising during the course of the day (like now at 11:30), but it's enough to know that there are periods of time during the day when I'm not fearful or anxious. Still doing the Body Scan at 13:00 every day despite having a painful ankle.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Tried another night off the Zopiclone. Fell asleep before dusk, then woke at 00:01, and didn't really go back to sleep. At 04:45, I took my codeine, then (craving some sleep) shortly after took a quarter Z. Slept after a fashion and then meditated till 09:00. Feeling quite rested now just before midday.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another night off the Zopiclone. Fell asleep before dusk, then woke at 23:00, and again at 02:00. At 04:45, I took my codeine, then meditated till 08:00. Feeling quite low & bleary now mid-morning.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another night off the Zopiclone. Fell asleep before dusk, then woke at 04:18. At 5, I took my codeine, then meditated till 08:00. Feeling quite low & bleary again now at 09:15. My body is still withdrawing, even from a quarter of a 7.5 Zopiclone, but it's getting better. Feeling anxious as well. The builders have a radio playing about 20 feet from the house, so that's a bit of a serenity test. Being careful myself to keep the volume well down when I'm practising guitar along to Transcribe.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Had a quarter the night of 16th July before my volunteering session. Woke at the same times, but didn't feel low & yuck in the morning.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Had a quarter last night before my appointment with Dr Higgins at Shipley Hospital. I fell asleep whilst meditating and woke after 11 some time. Took my quarter, then woke again at 2 and 4 feeling anxious. Nerves about my appointment, no doubt. Started meditating at 05:20, up at 08:05.
Food shopping in Shipley after my appointment and the receptionist at Shipley Hospital said to try Iceland. It wasn't just frozen goods as I'd thought, but had a range of fresh items and some good frozen ready meals.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Waiting for my bus in Shipley market square, I noticed another bus going to to Buttershaw. "That name rings a bell" I thought, then realised that it was the home of Andrea Dunbar.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another night off the Zopiclone. Fell asleep before dusk, then woke just before 1 o'clock, then again just after 4 o'clock. At 5, I took my codeine, then meditated till 08:00. Feeling quite low & anxious again now at 09:45. Going to do another night off tonight.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Another night off the Zopiclone. Fell asleep before dusk, then woke just after 2 o’clock. Feeling quite wakeful, I took a Nurofen Plus, then woke again just after 4 o’clock. At 5, I took my codeine, then meditated till 08:30. Feeling fair today, some anxiety but better than yesterday.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Had a quarter the night of 21st July before my volunteering session. Woke at the same times, but didn’t feel low & yuck in the morning.
Another night off the night of 22nd July. Feeling quite low & anxious today. My Amazon parcel arrived, but both items were oversized. Worrying about whether to return them or not. Spent a couple of hours lying on my bed this morning. Have done both morning and afternoon walks, but only eaten lightly. This house stays very cool in the heat - it's 29 degrees outside at the moment, but cold in the house. I might have to put my T-shirt back on at this rate! Haven't checked Facebook today. Don't feel like being sociable.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Off the Zopiclone for good now, for better or worse. Fell asleep on a warm muggy night fairly rapidly, awakened at midnight by fireworks going off, then awake again at 01:14. Couldn't get back to sleep, so took a Nurofen Plus, slept till 4, codeine at 5 feeling as though I hadn't slept properly. Lay in bed meditating till midday, sometimes managing to achieve quiet rest and loss of pain in my ankle.
Talked to my neighbour Dave (the man who looks like a Viking!) for about half an hour after popping into Westgate Stores to buy a bottle of Dr Pepper from Rani. He is even more irked by the building noise than me (especially the angle grinder) as he works nights (as nightclub "security" I think). He has written to various people with no success. He tells me that the builders managed to break the water pipe at number 2 on the corner, which is presumably why they dug the whole church driveway up.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Fell asleep on another warm muggy night fairly rapidly, and awake at 04:48. Took codeine, meditated, up at 06:45. That was a surprise, as I thought it was later.
Sent two Amazon parcels back this morning.
It was very warm in the house when I got up, but I've had the windows open and it's quite cool now at 11:20, at least downstairs. Upstairs is still quite warm. Not sure if I need to get the dusty A/C unit working. The temperature is forecast to drop quite markedly after a storm this evening.
Making some Wikipedia edits to the Robert Plant article.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Very warm last night, hot in bed even with my T-shirt off. Still awake at dusk and stomach hurting (had prawns in paella earlier), so took a Nurofen Plus. Must have fallen asleep fairly rapidly because I missed the storm. Awake at 03:45, went back to sleep till 5, codeine, meditation till 08:15. Had my earplugs in for some of that time.
It felt very warm when I got up and feels quite mild now a couple of hours later. Full of anxiety, some it focussed on an expected inspection on 27th. I have been worrying about that (and the boiler service check due 25th July) for about two months now :-( Had unpleasant thoughts during my meditation about feeling this anxious for ever and nothing working to alleviate it.
The teenage girl who lives next door with Bob (who must be her dad) had friends around on the hot afternoon yesterday and at one point started playing music quite loudly with the door open. It didn't last very long, though, and they were all gone by about 3, when I arrived back from my afternoon walk along Baildon Bank. It's a kind of running anxiety nightmare for me, having noisy neighbours from hell.
On a more positive note, no eczema on my arms and abdomen this morning. Slight amount on my lower legs, which I guess will be the last part of my body to still have it.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Woke at 23:30 last night full of anxiety about Skyping with Adam and the gas safety check with Matt. Got up and took a mild ranitidine and a Nurofen Plus, but was restless until waking fully at 04:45. Codeine & meditation until 9. At one point in the night, I thought it was silly to worry as I would probably enjoy both social encounters and it would all be finished in time for my Body Scan time. Which it was, by 13:45.
The Skype with Adam was good, apart from a botched start when I couldn't get the webcam to work. Adam Skyped me on my iPhone, which was almost as good as a PC connection in some ways. Smaller picture of course, and a bit quiet, but we had a good long chat. He is writing three TV filmlets for afternoon French TV, for which he will get £24k. Good grief!
Found out today that Dick Courtney died 25th July. So sad. I am coming to realise that nobody has a perfect, pain-free life. Gill always seemed and seems so happy and content and now she has the utter heartbreak of losing her man of 40-odd years.
Haven't been out for a walk since Friday, when I walked to Boots to collect my repeat scrip.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: After staying up till 19:45 editing my iTunes library, slept through till 04:48 with no extra medication. Stayed in bed all day though, and took a Nurofen Plus at about 09:30.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had some fatty snacks yesterday PM after getting up at about 16:30, and fell asleep after getting heartburn and taking a strong ranitidine. Hot, sweaty, disturbed sleep, anxious about volunteering on Tuesday. Set alarm for 08:00, got up at that time, shower, shave, shopping, rang Liz about getting the chimney swept, and arrived for volunteering at 12:00. A busy old session, but I stayed calm and in good spirits (although I did find myself watching the clock a couple of times).

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep as normal and slept through till just before 6 with no extra medication.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep as normal and slept through till just before 5 with no extra medication. Meditated till 8 feeling fearful & anxious about starting talking therapy. Taking it slowly this morning, one thing at a time. My inner critic is trying to shame me about small mistakes I made during my last library volunteering session.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 03:00 the past couple of nights. Mornings and early afternoon tend to be quite anxiety-filled for me, only lightening really at about 16:00. But I'm not depressed, which is odd. Eating well, keeping clean, getting stuff done round the house, getting out for my walks. Had lunch upstairs at Pickles with Sarah yesterday, followed by some garden shopping at B&M. Feeling bad because the pot I bought had a chip on the rim and I hadn't noticed. It doesn't really matter that much in truth. Also stressing because I bought a 50l bag of compost. Again, I'm not really sure why.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
There is no doubt about it. However much I might dislike and kvetch about the CBT course, going makes me feel better. I slept through till just before 6 last night and was up at just after 8. The building site is very quiet as it's raining steadily and I am inside drinking coffee, eating an Eton Mess cookie, and ironing hankies.
Happy coincidences -- I woke up with Barbra Streisand's song People running through my head and a Streisand song (Stoney End) was played on the morning's Caroline Top Fifteen. I have never heard a Streisand song on Radio Caroline before as far as I can remember.
Collected my M&S parcel from the Baildon Off Licence shop on my way home. (Walked through Saltaire, a pleasant walk and shorter than I'd expected.) It was a bit of an iffy experience. The checkout software was playing up, the assistant spent about twenty minutes scanning and rescanning my barcode, typing long numbers in, and serving a queue of other people in between. My legs hurt by the end and I felt hot & tired. Walked out, crossed the road to the bus-stop, and a bus appeared about a minute later! And the T-shirts fit fine. So all things considered, I shall use that service again.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept through till just before 6 last night and was up at just before 8.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept through again till just before 6 last night and was up at just before 8. I did wake in the night with a very dry mouth and noticed that I was sleeping with my mouth partially open. I wonder if this may be the cause of the persistent hoarse voice I've been suffering from for the last few months. My mental and physical health are both pretty good at the moment, although I have been missing my afternoon walks for the past few days, so my legs are a bit weak & sore.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake early, possibly 4. Worried about something -- the roof, doctor's appointment? Got up, had a pee, and took a Nurofen Plus. Meditated till 07:45. At 08:30, I was about to take the recycling bag out (with my T-shirt off), when I heard voices outside the front door. It was Liz and her dad responding to my message about the roof. There is apparently nothing wrong with the roof, so the cause of the mysterious loud crash yesterday is still a mystery. Good to have a fast response from Liz and to know that the roof isn't about to cave in!

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake early, possibly 4. Anxious about my volunteering shift. Up just before 8 and anxious all morning. Took a Nurofen Plus just before leaving at 11:50 as my right knee hurt. None of the things I was anxious about happened and it was a calm productive time, with lots of chatting (to both library users and my work colleagues). Siobhan had swapped with Lynn, so I had no need for the apology I had prepared. I also prefer her to work with and I think the feeling is mutual. She said something as I was leaving about being good to meet you. I asked her about Saturdays and she works them. So I've signed up for a morning shift.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake again early, possibly 4. Anxious about my talking therapy? Up just before 8 and anxious all morning. Low mood, not hungry can't focus properly on anything, small obstacles in my day seeming troublesome (Co-op assistant scolding me for moving my shopping around on the annoying checkout, a builders gate obstructing the pathway). It's all small stuff, really, but feels arduous and complicated and vaguely threatening. Oh dear. The weather doesn't help. Sun and rain and wind all mixed up today. It can't make its mind up and neither can I.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 05:36, but during an unpleasant series of dreams. Didn't feel rested or like getting up on a cold grey rainy day, so stayed in bed meditating till 12:30, when I did the Body Scan and got up just before 2.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: To bed at 19:20 and awake at 05:20, but once again didn’t feel rested or like getting up, so stayed in bed meditating till just after 9. I got up because I couldn't stand my mental state, lots of shaming thoughts, so wanted a distraction. Still feel full of anxiety at 3, with that old abdominal pain & nausea. Have done some housework and watered my plants, eaten well, and had a Body Scan & rest from 13:20 till just before 3, so something is right with me. Just jumpy and watchful & worried all the time.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: It feels cold today, although for a time I had my T-shirt off. One of those will it, won't it days for sunshine.
Why do I feel so rotten at the moment when I felt fine last week? It's not fair.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 02:52 with stomach pain. Got up and took a Solpadeine Max. Went back to sleep, awake again at 05:20. Meditated feeling quite pleasant, so stayed with it till just before 10. Have been out for a walk and done the usual morning things, but feel hot, tired & anxious at 12:30.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep at dusk to the sound of fireworks. Awake at 04:40 and stayed in bed with the Monday blues till about 14:30. Took two Nurofen Plus at about 10.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 05:20 and stayed in bed again till 2. Took a Solpadeine Max at 1. Feel low with no appetite, even after getting up.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke just before 02:00 to the sound of distant fireworks. Surely not? Awake properly at 05:20 and stayed in bed again till 10. Have showered, been shopping at the Co-op and eaten a proper day's food.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: After doing the Body Scan and having a very short rest, I am sitting with my T-shirt off on a grey, rather humid afternoon whiffling about. Viewing photos, reading the news, commenting on Facebook, eating apples and Tunnocks tea cakes. The usual stuff.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Hospital appointment today at 11:30 at Bradford Royal Infirmary. I tried to prepare my travel plans well and then not stress, but it wasn't so easy to achieve. Awake just after 2, couldn't get back to sleep, got up and took a Solpadeine Max. After a little while it felt as though it was getting light, so I checked the clock which said 05:20. Lay trying to meditate and deep breathe, but felt quite panicky. Worrying about asking the driver of the Bradford bus to give me a shout when we got to Westgate stop W4 and about how to hide the taskbar on Windows (something which Abi couldn't do yesterday and which I couldn't help her with).
So, the journey. Caught a 626 instead of the planned 649, which got me to the Shipley bus stop with minutes to spare. Asked the driver as planned, then realised that the 737 has a visual display with stop announcements. In the end, he didn't tell me and we sailed past the W4 stop. Backtracked, tried finding the stop for the 617, but couldn't find it. Re-read the Google instructions, backtracked again, found the stop but I'd missed the bus. Phoned the hospital to say I was probably going to be 10-15 minutes late. A 620 bus turned up a couple of minutes later, asked the driver if he was going to the hospital, which he was. Except it was the wrong side. Asked a woman in the hospital for directions and ended up getting to ENT only seven minutes late.
I was seen about 15 minutes later by a female Chinese doctor. Had a nose probe inserted and, as I suspected, nothing wrong with my throat or vocal cords. She gave me a prescription for a load of anti-acid medication in case my hoarse voice is due to "silent reflux" (lansoprazole, Gaviscon Advance). The Gaviscon is flavoured with aniseed and tastes vile. A little Dr Pepper may help with that.
Similar shenanigans on the way home, asking the driver for a shout when we got to Bradford Interchange. It was all good humoured, though, and the lady sitting next to me told me in the end. The driver did tell me where to catch the 626 back to Baildon, though, which saved me more wandering the streets with a compass trying to work out the Google Maps directions. All in all, I was out of the house for just under four hours.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Two of the symptoms of "silent reflux" (laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR)) are difficulty swallowing and discomfort behind the breastbone in the middle of the trunk. I have had both of those and have been getting rid of the chest discomfort by lying on my side for five minutes. I thought it was wind, but maybe this moves the excess acid.

My plan for the week is being kind to myself. Going for my appointment and taking my medicine both contribute to that, ironically. I also need to work on ignoring minor irritations (background music on documentaries and website overlays being two today).
The lansoprazole reduces how much acid your stomach makes and the Gaviscon Advance neutralises stomach acid.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 05:25, up at 07:35. A good library session, although I was a bit tired by the end. Siobhan is good to work with as she is very patient and shows me how to do things. And I told her so. She said, well you're doing fine and thanked me at the end of the session. I feel more well today than for a good few days past. More placid. I had a restful Body Scan despite having a painful ankle and noises coming in through the front window (which was open because of the warmth today). Got up and made a pot of tea, drank that while waiting for my beef madras and rice to cook. Reading on the sofa this afternoon (mostly Asa Briggs's book on Bletchley Park) and a nice Facebook Messenger chat with Sarah.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Today I am grateful for these things:
  • My eczema has just about disappeared.
  • Liz has mended the wonky waste pipe. She must have done it when I was out last week.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Wakened at 00:52 by distant fireworks. Got up and took a Nurofen Plus. Awake properly at 05:40, up at 07:30.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 03:42. Went back to sleep, but took a Solpadeine Max at about 7 for abdominal pain.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept through till 05:35, no physical pain, up at 8, have done my chores & been out for a walk, and now I feel quite low & anxious. Sadness & loneliness after a day shopping & snacking with Sarah yesterday, maybe?

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 05:30 but only up at 10:30. Had a Solpadeine Max at about 06:00 due to abdominal pain. Once the pain had gone I felt so rested that I didn't want to get up. It didn't help that it was a cold grey morning, either.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 05:35, up at 08:15. It's a rain & sunshine day, cool at 15C. I've been out to buy some milk, done a wash, ironed a tea towel and a T-shirt, had a shave and am now eating home-cooked fish & chips for lunch. To be followed by half a large custard tart with creme fraiche and thick double cream. My voice is healing, I think. Still full of constant anxiety, though. It makes me easily hot & tired.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: More ankle pain than normal yesterday evening and bailed out to lie on my bed at 5 ish after taking 30 mg codeine phosphate. Rested till 7, but couldn't get to sleep properly. Awake at 02:38 and didn't really go back to sleep at all. Stayed in bed till 12, took another 30 mg codeine phosphate, a Nurofen Plus, and two Solpadeine Max. Phoned up MyWellbeing College to cancel my appearance at CBT this afternoon. My ankle hurts and my back hurts in between my shoulder blades.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I wonder if my back pain is due to some guitar playing?
I think so. It's gone now (after a week not playing).

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept well, awake at 06:03 or some such, but empty & sad on waking. Got up just before 8 as the builders started to clatter about. It was the tarmac guys and they have just laid yet another layer of tarmac. Let's hope it's the last. Out to the Co-op for a problem-free shop, have showered and eaten, but am still full of anxiety just before 4 now. It's at quite an unpleasant level where I feel like I'm going bonkers. My back isn't so bad today but my abdomen and ankle both hurt, my ankle quite badly. Distressed in the early afternoon (and during my Body Scan & rest) by the sound of one of the tarmac machines left to run while they were elsewhere. Had my earplugs in and the bedroom space heater on at one point. I feel cold when I lie down and hot when I'm up and moving about. Ugh. Got my library volunteering session tomorrow and have been fiddling with this new build (1709) of Windows. Everything seems to be working okay now.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Bailed out again to lie on my bed at 5 ish and had a small sleep till 19:02. It was quite restful. Awake at 02:50 and once again didn’t really go back to sleep at all. Stayed in bed with acute anxiety till 12:30, and took another 30 mg codeine phosphate and two Nurofen Plus. Phoned up the library at 09:38 to cancel my session. Feeling pretty bad about that as it's the second time I've cancelled at short notice.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept through till 6, but stayed in bed till 12:00, and took another 30 mg codeine phosphate and two Nurofen Plus. Worrying about potential fallout from cancelling my volunteering session. And criticising myself.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept fitfully till 6, but stayed in bed till 11:30, and took another two Nurofen Plus. Checked my email at 09:30 to see a very sweet message from Rachel. No fallout from cancelling my volunteering session. Apparently Linda said that I was "fantastic at shelf-tidying" and that I had "a real eye for detail". Up and eating and washing some clothes but still quite anxious. I haven't been out at all for three (or is it four?) days now. Today is cold, wet, and grey. Completed my Mulig clothes rack last Friday and working on the other one in stages. May do some ironing later. Sarah mentioned on Facebook yesterday that she's also been stuck in the house for a while feeling poorly.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Slept through till 6, up at 09:15. Had abdominal pain whilst resting on my back and found that lying on my side for 10 minutes eased it. Is this due to silent reflux, I wonder. Have showered, been out for a walk around the block, had a coffee and granola bar, and done a weekly clothes wash. Quite anxious. My "rubber plant" doesn't look well (although there is new growth at the top and plantlets around the base). Leaves dying at the bottom and the stem looks discoloured. I also checked my Co-op receipt (which I don't normally do) and found that I had been charged for two packets of coffee. The scan was done by the man on the tobacco counter. Hmm... advantages of doing it yourself, maybe.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Two things about being charged twice for a packet of coffee: * I did the same thing myself yesterday (almost scanned an item twice). * I was only charged £1.40 (special offer on two) and have nearly £6 in membership rewards.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Took a while to get to sleep, then awake at 02:23 and again at 04:00. At which point I took my morning codeine. Spent the morning in bed till 11:30. Full of fear about upcoming appointments this week and the next. I have been to Westgate Stores and the Co-op for food and am now eating a salmon linguine at half three in the afternoon.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep with no problems. Awake at 04:00, but slept through till 6. Up at 08:45.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep eventually after taking more Gaviscon and going to the loo. Awake at 02:00, took a Nurofen Plus, awake again just before 5. Up at 08:30. Washed and dressed, out for a walk, but felt kayoed by about 10:30. Lay on my bed and did three Body Scans, got up at 14:00. Have eaten a paella, made (and eaten) a bread and butter pudding, and feeling in better spirits by 5.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Took a while to get to sleep, then awake at 03:30. Didn't properly go back to sleep. Up at 07:45. Nerves about my volunteering session, which went fine with the help of Siobhan.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Fell asleep with no problems and slept through till 6. Up at 07:30.
I've been pondering recently about having a sense of fractured identity with some major life changes in the recent past (and the chronic anxiety that has accompanied them). I'm at the point where I don't need medication, but meaning (and meditation).

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Fell asleep with no problems and slept through till 04:30. Drowsed till 6, when I took my codeine and started meditating on my back. Up at 07:30.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Feeling much improved in my mood this morning. Went out shopping quite early (half past eight or so) to the Co-op in my trousers. A cool bright morning with that autumn tang in the air.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
After a couple of nights sleeping through till 6 or so, and getting up at 07:30, last night I woke just after 1, then again at 03:30. Wakeful in the latter part of the night, but up at 07:15. Some anxiety about the last CBT session today, I guess.
My paint by numbers kit arrived this morning at about 09:30 by Royal Mail parcel service. The delivery guy said he was pleased to see me and I said the same thing to him.
Now, trousers or shorts later?

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
After a couple of nights sleeping through till 5 or so, and getting up at 07:45, last night I woke just after 01:11, then again at 03:44. Wakeful in the latter part of the night, but up at 07:45. Some anxiety about a last-minute library session today, I guess.
Dr Kennedy just called with a couple of questions about my referral to the Living With Pain course. Does my pain interfere with any daily activities (no) and have I felt anxious or low in the past two weeks about my pain (yes).

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 04:44 last night, but wanted to sleep more. Been feeling blue most of the day, and it's cold (14 C) and rainy, which doesn't help. Went shopping at the Co-op this morning in my shorts, though. My ankle hurts more than normal, including when I walk (which doesn't usually cause me any extra bother). Both my knees are sore with arthritis, maybe worsened by the wet weather. After my Body Scan, I did some Knowledge meditation, which seems to help with both my sad mood and my pain.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Awake at 04:14 last night, up at 07:30 to a very dark and rainy morning. Worrying about the rain, my volunteering session today, and getting a flu jab.
