To bed and Body Scan at 18:20. Woke at 23:10 and took half a Z. Awake at 06:19 and took my morning codeine. Up at 9 for the bins and to do a Co-op shop. On the way out, I decided to pop in to the YourMove office to see what was happening about my viewing. It turned out that Nicky is on leave this week and the notes said that I would be calling to arrange. Hmm... Anyway, have arranged a viewing for 14:30 today and Sarah will be able to accompany. Feeling quite restless, as might be expected. Got almost all of my Co-op shopping. They are refurbishing the store and have moved a lot of the aisles around.
My middle finger is very dry with peeling skin. But my bot is not sore or prolapsed or leaking. Moved last night.
Have got my birthday card and my birthday present from Sarah and done a viewing, filled out the application (me) and guarantor (Sarah) forms, and had the application accepted. Kadie rang just after 4 with the good news. She's leaving YourMove at the end of this week. All in the space of an afternoon. Have eaten three apples and three Tunnocks teacakes today, but it's fine.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
To bed at 18:25, no Body Scan. Woke at 20:41 and took half a Z. Awake at 05:26 and took my morning codeine. Up at 10:45 after an increasingly fretful meditation. At one point, I was seized with panic about not knowing where the removal van would be able to park at the apartment block. I also had a couple of moments of light doing the calming breath.
Dr Kennedy rang early (just as I was finishing a midday meditation). She thinks my bot is dermatitis and that the discharge is caused by constipation. She also thinks that my scabby finger is due to an infection. Anyway, she has prescribed a raft of medication and creams, including penicillin and a refill of my Zopiclone scrip. I have a couple left, so good timing.
Feeling rather ga-ga today, low and anxious. It feels like I've got loads to do. Made some Goosnargh biscuits and got some items from Westgate. And walked to Boots a couple of times. Quite busy both times, but the exercise will do me good and I'm not in a rush just yet.
And Rani left some barfi for me in the fridge. How thoughtful. I have had several brief glimpses today of some impending calm. I only need to take things a day at a time and only need to do a couple of tasks on my mental to-do list.
To top it all, I got a strange email from a company called Wayfair telling me that my email address philchamp@yahoo.co.uk was used to sign in on a new device and that I need to reset my password immediately. Never heard of them and certainly don't have an account, so deleted the email. The links all look valid, so not a phishing attempt. My email was included in the Yahoo data breach back in the mid 2010s, so maybe someone has created a spoof account. Or is this some bizarre method of getting people to use their site? They sell things...

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:02 02:13 Cod 02:37 0.25 Z 02:48 2 NP 10:00
Moved last night. Have eaten today.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:30 02:26 0.5 Z 06:21 Cod 12:30
Felt quite calm lying in bed meditating this morning. Not happy exactly, but not anxious.
Have been using Eumovate on my left middle finger and it's almost cleared up. Have binned my Betnovate as it expired July 2019. I don't seem to have pruritis, thank goodness.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Got no guarantor and the landlord can't accept without as their rent cover insurance policy requires one. So, unless I can come up with a guarantor by close of play Wednesday, I'll have to withdraw my application. A rental of £470-480 would require no guarantor.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:20 21:10 0.5 Z 01:01 03:49 Cod 05:44 08:02
A restless evening and night, pleased that Sarah was able to be my guarantor after all, but fretting endlessly about the forthcoming conversation with Nicky at YourMove. Tracy told me yesterday evening that Nicky would call this morning, and she did (at 09:16). She was fine. And the business with emailing the form turned out to be, as is logical, a PDF attachment to be printed out and posted back. (Although Sarah doesn't have a printer. It's a good job she hung on to the printed copy!)
I'm still quite full of anxiety this morning, although it's all sorted now, and feeling cold. Got the heating turned up and both space heaters on. Now where's that second delivery of light-bulbs?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The second delivery of light-bulbs is due today. By 8 pm, no less. Delivered by Royal Mail. Shipped 21 October, no tracking ID. Good grief :-( There are several recent bad reviews complaining of late delivery. And also a lot more good reviews. So we shall see. I need to go to the loo for a poo, so slightly concerned about getting an inconvenient knock on the door :-)

Facebook are "sunsetting" the Notes "experience". I have several draft notes which will be deleted and which I may want to keep for old times sake. I wonder if they are in the Facebook downloads that I've created and saved?

I am in a sour humour, it must be said. No joy, no real appetite (although I'm eating), and no energy. Lying on my bed and starting at the sound of doors slamming. Cars, vans, and houses. When my neighbour shuts his door, my house shakes. Need to put the recycling bin out this afternoon and may need a brolly.
No, they're not included in the data download. Can't find any way of saving them on the net. Publish them with Only me as the audience, then download the Facebook data?
Royal Mail delivery times: "We aim to deliver to addresses in urban areas by 3pm every working day and addresses in rural areas by 4pm every working day"
Unless it's Parcelforce: "we deliver Monday to Friday 7am to 5.30pm"

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:25 00:57 Cod 04:00 05:35 11:30
Have eaten today. Waiting all day to move before going out to the Co-op. The lightbulbs arrived with the postman, as I half expected.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
19:06 01:17 Cod 03:07 08:50
A wet day. The Co-op is still being refurbished. Only half the usual fresh and chilled cabinets. Workmen wandering around with no masks on.Very few ready meals and no pork pies. Got shepherds pie and cornish pasties, cold roast chicken thighs, and a chorizo. Should go well with vine tomatoes. It was mayhem as far as the one-way signs and distancing went, with long cabinets and large gaps in some places. Only one person barked at me to keep my distance, a member of staff, and I know that she had time off for health anxiety due to Covid.
Moved this morning. Very solid, but I have no leakage or soreness. Will be eating today, I hope. Have a CBT phone appointment at 12:30.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:35 02:35 Cod 03:09 2 NP 08:45
Had my quarterly conversation with the good Dr Higgins this morning. Only got vaguely fretful about it lying in bed this morning. We spent 3m 20s talking and he rang at 10:27, which is pretty much the time that Keser Hussain predicted a while back. He must do them in alphabetical order.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:30 23:30 Cod 03:44 08:50
Moved twice this morning. My left ankle and right knee hurt today.
Went shopping at Westgate this morning. Got what I needed with some help from Suni. It's quite difficult to move around the shop and get the things you need with the piles of Hermes parcels on the floor.
Lynn W continues to leave irrelevant illiterate comments on my posts. It's beginning to get quite tiresome.
The weather is getting a bit mad again, swings from warm to cold, wet to dry, windy to calm. Wind speeds in the 40s are forecast for late tomorrow and Monday.
Split my thumbnail yesterday trying to get a photograph of Adam into the photo frame that Sarah gave me for my birthday. It's a bit inconvenient as it's on my right hand and I'm fingerpicking and transcribing Coconut Grove. Got the time signature figured out at last, though. It's 9/8. Haven't come across that one before.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Two flowering pots that I bought from the Co-op have been sat on a sunny window sill for a couple of months and I have been watering and feeding them regularly. The rose has already developed several blooms and the crysanthemum now has many flower heads on it.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:15 00:33 Cod 04:10 06:50 09:55
Moved this morning. Have got a sore wet bot. Applied some Eumovate.
Had a nice lie-in and pleasant meditation for three hours this morning. Another blooming lockdown starting tomorrow. My haircut for next week has been cancelled.
Have had a bath, washed my hair, watered the indoor plants, had coffee and cookies, and put a weekend wash (pillowcases, teatowel, flannel etc.) on.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
17:30 23:13 Cod 01:32 04:00 2 NP 13:00
It was quite noisy with bangs last night, so I put earplugs in loosely for my first sleep.
Had a very long restful meditation this morning.
It was quite windy and rainy last night and the bolster against the back door was wet this morning. Not stained, as I guess rainwater is quite clean.
My bot is fine after two days of Eumovate.
The lockdown starts Thursday 5th and won't be as restrictive as the one in March/April, so I'm hoping that there won't be shortages in the Co-op. Apart from that, it doesn't really affect me. The "careful" age has been reduced to 60. Also not sure how it will affect moving. They're key workers, I would have thought.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:45 00:11 Cod 04:15 08:15
An early start to the day with a phone call from Experian (or whoever they outsource their background checking to) at 08:12. Bit of a confused conversation with an Indian lady, the nub of which was that they'd sent me an email and she wanted to warn me about it. It was the same as last time I jumped through these hoops, namely three months' worth of personal bank statements.
Got up, got dressed, and out to the Coop. No queues, got just about everything I needed. No candles, though. Out again to see Rani for some ice-cream. No candles there either.
This afternoon at about 2 o'clock, I decided to bite the bullet and start getting quotes from removal firms. Decided to look for Baildon-local firms with good Yell ratings. Contacted three, now it's wait and see. Had it done by 4.
Decided to light the stove, both to get rid of some of the fuel I've got stashed and also because it's a lot colder today (8 C). The cushions were damp again this morning. I wonder if it's condensation that builds up overnight and liquefies when the heating comes on? It struck me a little while ago that I have the boiler completely off for 12 hours a day, which means the house cools right down. At the Old School House, I used to have it set to drop to a lower temperature, so it never went completely cold.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:30 23:21 Cod 02:10 03:30 2 NP 06:20 10:00
Simon from Troutbeck Removals rang to say that he can't come tomorrow as he has to go for a COVID test on Friday. No word yet from the other two companies I've contacted. I may need to cast my net wider.
Experian are fussing about my bank statements.
Mary is fussing on Facebook, with "helpful" posts.
Have made a batch of biscuits and put my pyjama bottoms on for a quick wash and dry. The other stuff can wait till tomorrow.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: And at 15:30, Karen from Pickersgills just called to arrange a valuation viewing with Andrew on Monday at 15:00. They're only a couple of miles away and she was calling from a landline, but the signal was atrocious. The line dropped three times. The signal was much better from my bedroom.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:20 23:38 Cod 04:21 04:58 2 NP 06:20 11:45
Quite loud with firework bangs near, so cleaned my ears out and put my earplugs in for my first sleep. Feeling meh today. Didn't feel like getting up, but I'm not sure it's better lying in bed on a cold grey day in the coldest part of the coldest room. Had a bath. Haven't moved yet today, but no soreness or leaking, so grateful for that.
Lit a fire as well. And now the sun is out and the sky is blue!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I have a sneaky feeling that my anxiety about the Experian email may be for nothing. I checked my Virgin and MBNA PDF statements this morning and they all had my address on the first page. It's quite possibly a legal requirement. Of course, I haven't actually *checked* my first direct statements yet. Something in me needs this pain...
"My identity as the wounded child" https://gailbrenner.com/2012/08/10-life-changing-facts-to-heal-the-pain-of-the-past/

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:30 22:05 0.5 Z 06:03 Cod 09:50
Very loud last night with firework noises, so cleaned my ears out, put my earplugs in, and shut the curtains for my first sleep.
Anxious today waiting for a call from Simon of Troutbeck Removals about a valuation. Liz has lit a bonfire and has caught my eye a couple of times as I move around the house. Rather unsettling, although she's not trying to get my attention. Bill never does it, even when he's right up close to the back of the house.
Moved at half past midday.
It was quite foggy this morning at 6, but it has burnt off to leave a lovely bright afternoon. All shall be well. Let me remember that and also that other people have their own worries and needs. Let there be enough space in my heart for that.
No appetite.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
17:20 18:20 22:36 0.5 Z 04:45 Cod 09:20
Skyped with Sarah at 11. Adam is going to buy me a sofa. The first surveyor is visiting at 4-5ish.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
17:00 18:10 23:22 0.5 Z 04:00 06:00 Cod 08:30 2 NP 15:45
A cold foggy day spent in bed with the heater on. No food today, although I did have a cup of tea after getting up. Managed a rebirth! For about an hour and a half from 14:20 to 15:40. Started it by using a fairly rapid and shallow continuous breath cyle for about 30-40 minutes, I think.
My Facebook news feed is filled with posts from Paul Lydon. I follow him, but he's not somebody I interact with a great deal. I liked and commented on one of his posts a couple of days ago, so maybe FB is clutching at straws again. And maybe I need to start using those Friend Lists again. He is an Acquaintance rather than a Close Friend.
And Windows has decided to quarantine the Product Key utility, which shows you the ProductIDs of a few key pieces of software installed on your computer. Oddly, it leaves the copy in the install zip alone.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Windows Security thinks it's a HackTool:Win64/ProductKey. It's not, although it has similar behaviour, scanning Product IDs.
Didn't use my earplugs last night. The fireworks noise was there, but it didn't feel so distracting.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
19:00 02:30 Cod 06:00 10:40 2 NP 12:30
Have eaten two apples (bought from Westgate) and had two pots of tea. Andrew the Pickersgill surveyor has been and left me feeling confident.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: And I am eating at just after 5. With some enjoyment.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:50 05:00 Cod 11:30
Had a good sleep. Very few bangs last night, but it took me while to get to sleep. Possibly because of the pork and tomatoes I had fairly late on. Rested pleasantly until my bladder encouraged me to get up.
Have moved this morning. Have fairly extensive low-level itchy eczema on my body, mostly on my left side. Have been appliying Diprobase cream, which as always is very effective, but I do have to wander around the the house looking like Withnail with cream slathered all over.
Bought some chicken tikka bites from Rani, who is not in the best of moods. She was awake at 4 and started cleaning the house. I have eaten the bites and have got a beef madras curry and basmati rice on the go.
Suni's name is spelt Sunny, Rani tells. Short for Sundeep.
I'm a little anxious today, but not panicky. Completed a COVID questionnaire for the University of Maryland and was quite careful to separate out chronic symptoms, but couldn't always do it. How often have you felt anxious/depressed in the last seven days? Well, how do I separate out my chronic anxiety from moving stress and COVID anxiety? They also asked me how long I'd spent in education. 13 years, right. Actually, it should have been 15 :-) Or 19?
4 years primary school 6 years secondary school 2 years art college 3 years first degree 4 years second degree
Whatever. It doesn't matter.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
19:00 03:17 Cod 05:23 09:00
Woke up feeling okay. Didn't look at the clock after half five, when I turned over and started meditating. Decided to get up when it felt right. Did that and discovered it was nine o'clock when I got downstairs. It felt somewhat longer. And I have been resting in bed without turning the space heater on.
Karen rang from YourMove yesterday afternoon at half four to confirm an appointment for something or other on 24th November.
I have been feeling mentally okay for the past few days. I like it and long may it continue. Found myself watching clips of Shaun and Bez from the Mondays yesterday evening doing a strange TV show called Gogglebox.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:35 01:06 Cod 05:54 08:48
Paid Pickersgill early yesterday afternoon and, following a phone call, had my moving date confirmed for 2nd December this morning. Karen has been amazing throughout. She sent me a smiley email thanking me for sending my acceptance form in.
Moved late this morning, quite solid.
It struck me yesterday that I must have completed the background checks. I sent the final proofs on 9th November and Nicky rang me fairly late on the 10th. I don't think she would be making appointments for me if that was still up in the air.
Broke my pint pee glass last night. It fell off the sink shelf and broke in the bowl. I am mildly surprised that it hasn't happened before and it was a good safe place for it to break. I need to get a large plastic beaker for this or some medical device.
Feeling quite knackered today with all the coming and going.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
18:20 22:41 02:09 Cod 06:15 09:00
Had a good session with CBT Catherine this morning. Insightful and productive, and done mostly on the fly. I forgot to do my homework in the heat of moving. I also have stopped filling out the mood questionnaires.
Have got bad discharge again. I had a Badedas bath in the past couple of days, and I'm fairly sure that caused it. It will pass in a day or two, but I don't fancy going out much till it does. Putting hand towels down to sit and lie on and washing my shorts and pants in the middle of the day.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
No times today, I couldn't be bothered recording them last night. After putting Eumovate on last night, my bot is much better. Perhaps I can get rid of the Anusol. It's chilly and foggy grey today, so the stove is lit.
The upstairs fire alarm chirped again this morning, so I silenced it. It doesn't chirp every 40 seconds, though, so it's not a low battery warning and the red light flashes every 40 seconds, which shows that it's working properly. I took it down and cleaned it this afternoon to see if that will fix it. It only chirps in the morning, which is odd. Maybe it does at other times of the day but I don't hear it. But it's never chirped when I go upstairs for a pee or a shave. If it gets annoying, it can be silenced by unscrewing the alarm from the base plate, which disconnects the battery.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
No times again today. Had a restful morning in bed. Up just before 12 to a bright blue cold day. Managed to get bleach on one of my towels. It doesn't wash out, I tried.
Bowie died two days after his 69th birthday. Crikey.
Still in good spirits, feeling fairly placid. Bot is better and so is my leg and trunk eczema.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Into the shadowlands again. In bed on a cold wet grey Monday morning with the space heater on till 10:30. There was a knock on the door at about 10:15. Rushed downstairs, forgot my key, shouted through the letterbox, upstairs for the key. It was a DPD driver and he handed me a parcel addressed to someone at 22a Westgate. I didn't take the parcel, thank goodness. Not wearing a mask or observing any precautions. I gave him directions to Westgate, went back to bed, and almost immediately started hearing the sounds of workmen. Not close, but audible all the same. So I got up.
Out to Rani's, but nothing on my list was available apart from ice cream.
Looking at Facebook posts and feeling sour.
Feeling panicky and breathing shallow. My ankle hurts a lot and I'm finding it difficult to concentrate.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: In bed till 11. Got up when I stopped feeling rested. Things to do on the moving front (text to Liz, email from YourMove). Feeling quite tired at twenty to three. Have had a bath, lit the stove and installed the Virgin Money credit card app on my phone. It works fine.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: And feeling panicky at 16:20. Trying to get times and appointments sorted out over a bad line to YourMove and with a hoarse voice. Not hungry. Have only eaten snacks today.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A restless night. Had half a Z around 10, but woke a couple of times. Up around 9 to fetch the bin and do some shopping at the Co-op. Got pretty much everything I needed, but they are low on ready meals. More to and froing with YourMove. We have an appointment set for the Pre-Sign Up (whatever that is). Now they want to see my passport. Which expired in August. Yet another phone call. Driving licence will do. Phew.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: And at 2 Suni knocks on my door to tell me that Jo Flecknoe is looking for a tenant for 5 Binswell Fold. Gah. Just about to complete my BT move services request. He had a card with her details, which I didn't take. I'm not going to back out now.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Had half a Z around 10, awake at just after 5. Stayed in bed till 12. Have been out three times, and had a nice long doorstep chat with a lady called Joanna, who lives at 19 High Fold, and has invited me to pop in for a cup of tea when things get calmer. Have been out shopping to Westgate Stores and Browgate Pharmacy and took some documents into YourMove. And eaten okay. A chilly cold but bright blue day.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Took two Nurofen Plus at about half 1. Dozed until about half 5. Meditated from 6 till getting up at half 9. Have done my CBT appointment and a clothes wash. My left eye stings and waters sometimes. Lit the stove and had the heating turned up full for the 7 C temperature this morning. I now feel very hot and my legs hurt. About to eat fish and chips and hard-boil some eggs.
My rosemary seedling has got some kind of bug. Sticky discoloured leaves and tiny white flies fly off when the leaves are disturbed. God, not the dreaded whitefly again. I've put two halves of a bug spike in the soil. And after reading about white fly infestations, have put the seedling outside.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A bit of a restless night. Awake at 03:57 and fell half-asleep till just after 6. Meditated till getting up just after 9. Was qute cold lying in bed, but I forgot to turn the space heater on. Quite anxious today. Can't settle. No appetite till just before 4.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke at about 01:30 and got up and took two Nurofen Plus. Awake at 07:22. Lay in bed meditating fairly peacefully till getting up at 13:30. A nice clear and bright sunny day, but cold at 7 C.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke at about 1 and went back to sleep. Awake at 06:22. Lay in bed meditating quite peacefully till getting up at 1. Had the space heater on for a few hours. It was nice and bright when I got up, but has gone back to light cloud. A bit warmer today at 9 C. Doing a bedding wash and heating a luxury fish pie. Need a shave and a Co-op shop.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: A good night's sleep but a bad day. Gloomy weather and gloomy me with pain in my abdomen. Couldn't get up, although I wanted to go out to the Co-op and Westgate Stores. Up eventually at half 3. Put the recycling bin out after some thought. Have had a large pot of tea but no food. Did move well earlier on in the day. Not leaking or bleeding.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke at about 01:30 and got up and took two Nurofen Plus. Up just before 9 to fetch the bin. Out to the Co-op and then Westgate. Sarah arrived at 11:15 for the Pre-Sign Up appointment, which took about 40 minutes. She had to dash off for her Zoom appearance, but I needed a lie-down anyway, so no problem. Completed a first direct BACS payment and set up a standing order, both of which filled me with some trepidation. Bought some vegan Ben & Jerrys Chocolate Fudge Brownie ice cream by mistake, and it is rather nice.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Awake at 04:50. Put the space heater on at about 05:30 ready for a cold 8 C morning. Up at about 11:45. Have eaten okay but feel the stirrings of anxiety. Colder tomorrow (4 C) and fog forecast to boot.
My arthritic knee hurts.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Awake just after 5. Put the space heater on at 6 ready for a cold 5 C morning. Up at 09:30 for my final CBT appointment. It went well.
Email shenanigans. Quite a lot of new junk mail today, and yet another email from YourMove asking for a copy of my birth certificate or a letter from government/council/pension. Luckily, I have two copies of my birth certificate, so took the bigger one in to the office. It has just occurred to me that I could have used my Winter Fuel Payment letter. To be fair, Nicky was apologetic and called it "pedantic". What a performance.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Woke at about 3 and got up and took two Nurofen Plus. Meditated quite pleasantly and before dawn managed to achieve a small rebirth. Felt like my spirit was expanding and contracting out of and in to my body.
Got up and put the space heater on at about 8. Very cold this morning (4 C) compared to past days. The smoke alarm beeped a couple of times at a 6-minute interval, so I got up and silenced it. I was shivering with cold when I got back into bed. Mind you, I was wearing my thick socks but no pyjama bottoms.
Skyped with Sarah. Unsure and anxious about Christmas. Can't really focus on anything till this blasted move is over and done with.
Forgot to water one of my snakeskin fritillary plantlets mid-week and it's looking very sorry for itself. I feel the same. It's dark and wet and cold today, house lights on and the heating turned up full. No appetite but going to eat fish and chips all the same.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded: Woke just before 4 and got up and took two Nurofen Plus. Meditated quite pleasantly till getting up at 12:30. Yet another grim day, although not so cold at 8 C. Had my PJ bottoms and thick socks on all night. Am fairly well constipated by now. Haven't moved for 4-5 days now. Have eaten fine today, same as yesterday.

item.dc:creator: phil
item.content:encoded:
Awake just after 6. Put the space heater on at about 7 ready for a coldish 9 C morning. Up at about 12:30 after meditating increasingly restlessly. Eating at 3 but with background anxiety. Have washed my hair in the shower and finally moved this morning (which got me up in the end). And got a clothes wash on the go.
Thinking about Ed this morning. He kind of followed the path that I would have liked. Out of Sophos for a few years freelancing and building up his savings, then back to Sophos. And so calm and collected through it all. Not really bothered about social interaction, but he told me he missed the chat when was at Semmle. I remember him getting up, walking out, and sitting in a company meeting at the front away from the rest of us in the Doc team. He would do that as well when he was having lunch in the canteen.
